TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Button Group Button component is creates a button component which is a graphical user interface that helps to triggers an event on its click action. 
            It can contain a text, an icon, svg or both. 
            </summary> 
            <remarks> 
            The button content is either by specifying <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton.Content" /> property or by specifying content within <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton" /> tag directive. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<exclude />
            <summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the child content for the button including HTML element. If the child content is not specified, button is rendered using <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton.Content" /> property. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            The child content which is specified within <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton" /> tag directive is either a string or HTML Element. The string content is also specified using <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton.Content" /> property. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the CSS class string to customize the appearance of button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance of button. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconCss
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the CSS class string to include an icon or image for the button.  
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to include an icon or image for the button. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Disabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets whether the button is disabled or not. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the button component is disabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Selected
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets whether the component is selected or not. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the component is selected. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Name
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the name of the component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            The <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton.Name" /> property is used to set the name attribute of input element. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Value
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the value of the component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            The <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton.Value" /> property is used to set the value attribute of input element. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Content
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the content of button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            Set child content within <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton" /> tag directive, to render as HTML content. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsToggle
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets whether the toggle option is enabled for button component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the toggle option is enabled for button component. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsPrimary
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets whether the primary style is enabled for button component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the primary style is enabled for button component. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates how to display icons in the button component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton.IconPosition" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.IconPosition.Left" /> 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Left</c>, the icon will be placed left to the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Right</c>, the icon will be placed right to the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Top</c>, the icon will be placed above the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Bottom</c>, the icon will be placed below the content of the button. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes that will applied to the button container element. Additional attributes can be added by specifying as inline attributes or by specifying @attributes directive. In the below code example, button width has been specified as style attribute in tag directive. Left Center Right ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Mode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the selection mode of the button group component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.SelectionMode" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.SelectionMode.Default" /> 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>Mode</c> is <c>Default</c>, it allows default selection in the button group component. 
            If the <c>Mode</c> is <c>Single</c>, it allows single selection in the button group component. 
            If the <c>Mode</c> is <c>Multiple</c>, it allows multiple selection in the button group component. 
            </remarks>

            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Duration
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the duration of the animation done in the progress button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a double value to set the duration of the animation of progress button. The default value is <c>400</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Easing
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the animation timing function of the progress button component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the progress UI is enabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Effect
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets the animation effect of the progress button component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.AnimationEffect" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.AnimationEffect.None" /> 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>AnimationEffect</c> is <c>SlideLeft</c>, the content will be moved with slide left  animation. 
            If the <c>AnimationEffect</c> is <c>SlideRight</c>, the content will be moved with slide right animation. 
            If the <c>AnimationEffect</c> is <c>SlideUp</c>, the content will be moved with slide up animation. 
            If the <c>AnimationEffect</c> is <c>SlideDown</c>, the content will be moved with slide down animation. 
            If the <c>AnimationEffect</c> is <c>ZoomIn</c>, the content will be moved with zoom in  animation. 
            If the <c>AnimationEffect</c> is <c>ZoomOut</c>, the content will be moved with zoom out  animation 
            </remarks>

            Gets or sets a value that indicates the animation timing function of the progress button component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the progress UI is enabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Effect
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets the animation effect of the progress button component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.AnimationEffect" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.AnimationEffect.None" /> 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>AnimationEffect</c> is <c>SlideLeft</c>, the content will be moved with slide left  animation. 
            If the <c>AnimationEffect</c> is <c>SlideRight</c>, the content will be moved with slide right animation. 
            If the <c>AnimationEffect</c> is <c>SlideUp</c>, the content will be moved with slide up animation. 
            If the <c>AnimationEffect</c> is <c>SlideDown</c>, the content will be moved with slide down animation. 
            If the <c>AnimationEffect</c> is <c>ZoomIn</c>, the content will be moved with zoom in  animation. 
            If the <c>AnimationEffect</c> is <c>ZoomOut</c>, the content will be moved with zoom out  animation 
            </remarks>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ProgressButtonSpinSettings
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the spin settings for the progress button.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Position
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the spinner position of the progress button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ProgressButtonSpinSettings.Position" /> enumeration. The default value is <c>Left</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>Position</c> is <c>Left</c>, the spinner will be placed left to the content of the progress button. 
            If the <c>Position</c> is <c>Right</c>, the spinner will be placed right to the content of the progress button. 
            If the <c>Position</c> is <c>Top</c>, the spinner will be placed above the content of the progress button. 
            If the <c>Position</c> is <c>Bottom</c>, spinner icon will be placed below the content of the progress button. 
            If the <c>Position</c> is <c>Center</c>, spinner icon will be placed below the content of the progress button. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a template content to be displayed in the progress button.  
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.SfSplitButton
TagHelpers.Documentation: SplitButton component has primary and secondary button. Primary button is used to select default action and secondary button is used to toggle contextual overlays for displaying list of action items. It can contain both text and images. SplitButton component has primary and secondary button. Primary button is used to select default action and secondary button is used to toggle contextual overlays for displaying list of action items. It can contain both text and images. SplitButton component has primary and secondary button. Primary button is used to select default action and secondary button is used to toggle contextual overlays for displaying list of action items. It can contain both text and images. SplitButton component has primary and secondary button. Primary button is used to select default action and secondary button is used to toggle contextual overlays for displaying list of action items. It can contain both text and images. In the below code example, a basic SplitButton component initialized with and tag directives. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the child content for the primary button element including HTML element. If the child content is not specified, primary button is rendered using <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.SfSplitButton.Content" /> property. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            The child content which is specified within <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.SfSplitButton" /> tag directive is either a string or HTML Element. The string content is also specified using <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.SfSplitButton.Content" /> property. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Content
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the content of split button component's primary button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            Set child content within <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.SfDropDownButton" /> tag directive, to render as HTML content. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the CSS class string to customize the appearance of split button component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance of split button component. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Disabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets whether the split button is disabled or not. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the split button is disabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets whether the right to left direction is enabled for split button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction is enabled for split button. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconCss
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the CSS class string to include an icon or image for the split button.  
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to include an icon or image for the split button. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates how to display icons in the split button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.SfSplitButton.IconPosition" /> enumeration. The default value is <c>Left</c>/> 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Left</c>, the icon will be placed left to the content of the split button component. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Right</c>, the icon will be placed right to the content of the split button component. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Top</c>, the icon will be placed above the content of the split button component. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Bottom</c>, the icon will be placed below the content of the split button component. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Items
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the action items with its properties which will be rendered as split button's secondary button.  
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a collection of <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.DropDownMenuItem" /> object. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>Items</c> property is not specified, the split button component's secondary button is populated using <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.DropDownMenuItems" /> and <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.DropDownMenuItem" /> tag directives. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a value that indicates the custom element as action items which will be rendered in split button popup. The template content. The default value is null. If the Items property and tag directive is not specified, the dropdown button is populated using . In the below code example, a DropDownButton component rendered with ListView component as . @code { public List Data = new List{ new ListData{ Class = "data", Text = "Print", Id = "data1" }, new ListData{ Class = "data", Text = "Save As", Id = "data2" }, new ListData{ Class = "data", Text = "Update Folder", Id = "data3" }, new ListData{ Class = "data", Text = "Reply", Id = "data4" } }; public class ListData { public string Text { get; set; } public string Id { get; set; } public string Class { get; set; } } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes such as id, title etc. that will applied to the split button container element. Additional attributes can be added by specifying as inline attributes or by specifying @attributes directive. In the below code example, split button width has been specified as style attribute in tag directive. ]]>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The class provides data for the animation to Dialog.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Delay
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the delay in milliseconds to start the animation.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Duration
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the duration in milliseconds that the animation takes to open or close the dialog.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Effect
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the animation name that should be applied on while opening and closing the dialog.
            If the user sets Fade animation, the dialog will open with the `FadeIn` effect and close with the `FadeOut` effect.
            The following are the list of animation effects available to configure to the dialog:
            1. Fade
            2. FadeZoom
            3. FlipLeftDown
            4. FlipLeftUp
            5. FlipRightDown
            6. FlipRightUp
            7. FlipXDown
            8. FlipXUp
            9. FlipYLeft
            10. FlipYRight
            11. SlideBottom
            12. SlideLeft
            13. SlideRight
            14. SlideTop
            15. Zoom
            16. None.
            </summary>

            Provides data to configure the Dialog button properties.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the content of the Spinner element.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: Content
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Defines the text `content` of the Button element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Defines the class/multiple classes separated by a space in the Button element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Disabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a value that indicates whether the Button is `disabled`.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable rendering component in the right to left (RTL) direction.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconCss
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Defines the class/multiple classes separated by a space for the Button that is used to include an icon.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Positions the icon before or after the text content in the Button.
            The possible values are: Left: The icon will be positioned to the left of the text content.
            Right: The icon will be positioned to the right of the text content.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsPrimary
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Allows the appearance of the Button to be enhanced and visually appealing when set to `true`.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsToggle
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Makes the Button toggle, when set to `true`.
            When you click it, the state changes from normal to active.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnClick
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Event triggers when `click` the dialog button.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Type
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the type of the button.
            Possible values are Button, Submit, and Reset.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsFlat
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the Flat appearance of the dialog buttons.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<exclude />
            <summary>
            You can add the additional html attributes such as id, title etc., to the button element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Created
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>

            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Destroyed
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Event triggers when the dialog is destroyed.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnClose
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Event triggers before the dialog is closed.
            If you cancel this event, the dialog remains opened.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnDrag
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Event triggers when the user drags the dialog.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnDragStart

BoundAttributes.Name: OnDragStop
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Event triggers when the user stops dragging the dialog.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnOpen
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Event triggers when the dialog is being opened.
            If you cancel this event, the dialog remains closed.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnOverlayModalClick
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Event triggers when the overlay of the dialog is clicked.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnResizeStart
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Event triggers when the user begins to resize a dialog.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnResizeStop
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Event triggers when the user stops to resize a dialog.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Opened

<summary>
            Event triggers when a dialog is opened.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Resizing
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Event triggers when the user resizes the dialog.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            Represents the dialog component that displays the information and gets input from the user.
            Two types of dialog components are `Modal and Modeless(non-modal)` depending on their interaction with the parent application.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the unique identifier.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets content for the Dialog element including HTML support and its customizations.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowDragging
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the value whether the dialog component can be dragged by the end-user.
            The dialog allows a user to drag by selecting the header and dragging it for re-positioning the dialog.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CloseOnEscape
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the Boolean value whether the dialog can be closed on pressing the escape (ESC) key.
            that is used to control the dialog's closing behavior.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Content
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the value that can be displayed in the dialog's content section.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the dialog.
            One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a dialog.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableResize
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the value whether the dialog component can be resized by the end-user.
            If the enableResize is true, the dialog component creates a grip to resize it in a diagonal direction.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ResizeHandles
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the resize handles direction in the dialog component that can be resized by the end-user.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable rendering component in the right to left (RTL) direction.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FooterTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the template value that can be displayed with the dialog's footer area.
            This is an optional property and can be used only when the footer is occupied with information or custom components.
            By default, the footer is configured with the action buttons.
            If the footer template is configured to the dialog, the buttons property will be disabled.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Header
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the value that can be displayed in the dialog's title area that can be configured with a plain text.
            The dialog will be displayed without the header if the header property is null.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Height
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the height of the dialog component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional Html attributes such as id, title, etc., to the dialog element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsModal
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the Boolean value whether the dialog can be displayed as modal or non-modal.
            `Modal`: It creates an overlay that disables interaction with the parent application and
             the user who should respond with modal before continuing with other applications.
            `Modeless`: It does not prevent user interaction with the parent application.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: MinHeight
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the min-height of the dialog component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowCloseIcon
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the value that represents whether the close icon can be shown in the dialogs title section.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Target
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the target element in which the dialog should be displayed.
            The default value is null, which refers to the `Document.body` element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Visible
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the value that represents whether the dialog component is visible.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: VisibleChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a callback of the bound value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the width of the dialog.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ZIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the z-order for rendering that determines whether the dialog is displayed
            in front or behind of another component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowPrerender
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets whether the Dialog element re-render or not when the Dialog gets open. true, if dialog component elements are maintained on the DOM when closing and opening it; otherwise, false.The default value is false. Disabling this property, the Dialog component DOM element will be destroyed when closing and re-rendered the dialog DOM element while opening it. Otherwise, the dialog will be shown when opening it and remain hidden while closing it when enabled.

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the target element in which the dialog should be displayed.
            The default value is null, which refers to the `Document.body` element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Visible
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the value that represents whether the dialog component is visible.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: VisibleChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a callback of the bound value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the width of the dialog.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ZIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the z-order for rendering that determines whether the dialog is displayed
            in front or behind of another component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowPrerender
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets whether the Dialog element re-render or not when the Dialog gets open. true, if dialog component elements are maintained on the DOM when closing and opening it; otherwise, false.The default value is false. Disabling this property, the Dialog component DOM element will be destroyed when closing and re-rendered the dialog DOM element while opening it. Otherwise, the dialog will be shown when opening it and remain hidden while closing it when enabled.

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.ChildContent
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets content for the Dialog element including HTML support and its customizations.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Documentation:

            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialogProvider
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            DialogProvider is a target element where the built-in dialogs are shown using <see cref="M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialogService.ConfirmAsync(System.String,System.String,Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogOptions)" />,
            <see cref="M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialogService.AlertAsync(System.String,System.String,Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogOptions)" /> and <see cref="M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialogService.PromptAsync(System.String,System.String,Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogOptions)" /> 
            methods that are appended to this element. 
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            It is recommended to add this component in `MainLayout.razor` to show utility dialogs from anywhere in the application.
            If you add this to any particular page, the utility dialogs can then be displayed only for that page.
            </remarks>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The SfTooltip component displays a pop-up containing information or a message when you hover, click, focus, or touch an element.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The SfTooltip component displays a pop-up containing information or a message when you hover, click, focus, or touch an element.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The SfTooltip component displays a pop-up containing information or a message when you hover, click, focus, or touch an element.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The SfTooltip component displays a pop-up containing information or a message when you hover, click, focus, or touch an element.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The SfTooltip component displays a pop-up containing information or a message when you hover, click, focus, or touch an element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Closed
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The event `Closed` will be fired when the Tooltip component gets closed.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Opened
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The event `Opened` will be fired after the Tooltip component gets opened.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnClose
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The event `OnClose` will be fired before the Tooltip hides from the screen.
            The Tooltip close can be prevented by setting the cancel argument value to true.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnCollision
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The event `OnCollision` will be fired for every collision fit calculation.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnOpen
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The event `OnOpen` will be fired before the Tooltip is displayed over the target element.
            When one of its arguments `cancel` is set to true, the Tooltip display can be prevented.
            This event is mainly used to refresh the Tooltip positions dynamically or to set customized styles in it and so on.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnRender
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The event `OnRender` will be fired before the Tooltip and its contents will be added to the DOM.
            When one of its arguments `cancel` is set to true, the Tooltip can be prevented from rendering on the page.
            This event is mainly used to customize the Tooltip before it shows up on the screen.
            For example, to load the AJAX content or to set new animation effects on the Tooltip, this event can be opted.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Created
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The event `Created` will be fired after the Tooltip component is created.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Destroyed
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The event `Destroyed` will be fired when the Tooltip component is destroyed.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<exclude />
            <summary>
            Defines the content which has to be passed.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<exclude />
            <summary>
            Defines the Id of the Tooltip component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Animation
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            It is used to customize the animation of the Tooltip while opening and closing.
            The animation property also allows you to set delay, duration, and various other effects of your choice.
            You can set the same or different animation options to the Tooltip when it is in the open or close state.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CloseDelay
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            To close the Tooltip after a specified delay in millisecond.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Content
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            To display the content of the Tooltip which can be a string element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            To customize the Tooltip which accepts the custom CSS class names that define specific
            user-defined styles and themes to be applied to the Tooltip element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableHtmlSanitizer
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            This property has been deprecated as we achieve this behavior by using ChildContent of render fragment type and and Content as a string value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            As there are no properties required to persist in tooltip component, this property is deprecated.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            To enable or disable the rendering component in the right to left direction.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: WindowCollision
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            It is used to set the collision target element as page viewport (window) or Tooltip element, when using the target.
            If this property is enabled, tooltip will perform the collision calculation between the target elements.
            and viewport(window) instead of Tooltip element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Height
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            To set the height of the Tooltip component which accepts the string values.
            When the Tooltip content gets overflowed due to the height value, then the scroll mode will be enabled.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsSticky
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            To display the Tooltip in an open state until it is closed manually.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: MouseTrail
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            It allows the Tooltip to follow the mouse pointer moves over the specified target element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OffsetX
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            It sets the space between the target and Tooltip element in X-axis.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OffsetY
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            It sets the space between the target and Tooltip element in Y-axis.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OpenDelay
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            To open the Tooltip after a specified delay in millisecond.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OpensOn
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            To determine the type of open mode to display the Tooltip content.
            The available open modes are Auto, Hover, Click, Focus, and Custom.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Position
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            To set the position of the Tooltip element with respect to the Target element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowTipPointer
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            To show or hide the tip pointer of the Tooltip.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Target
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            To denote the target selector where the Tooltip needs to be displayed.
            The target element is considered as the parent container.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Container
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            It is used to set the container element in which the Tooltips pop-up will be appended.
            It's default value is `body`, in which the Tooltips pop-up will be appended.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: TipPointerPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            It is used to customize the position of the tip pointer on the tooltip. The available options are Auto, Start, Middle, and End.
            When set to auto, the tip pointer gets auto adjusted within the space of the target's length and does not point outside.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            To set the width of the Tooltip component which accepts a string value.
            When set to auto, the Tooltip width gets auto adjusted to display its content within the viewable screen.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase<T>
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The Calendar is a graphical user interface component that displays a Gregorian Calendar, and allows a user to select a date.
            </summary>
            <typeparam name="T">Specifies the type of CalendarBase.</typeparam>

BoundAttributes.Name: T
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter T for the Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase<T> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: Max
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a maximum date that is allowed a user can select in the calendar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Min
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a minimum date that is allowed a user can select in the calendar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FirstDayOfWeek
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the calendar's first day of the week. By default, the first day of the week will be based on the current culture.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CalendarMode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the calendar's type like Gregorian.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: DayHeaderFormat
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the format of the day that to be displayed in the header. By default, the format is short.
            <para>Possible formats are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Short</term>
            <description>Sets the short format of day name (like Su ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Narrow</term>
            <description>Sets the single character of day name (like S ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Abbreviated</term>
            <description>Sets the min format of day name (like Sun ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Wide</term>
            <description>Sets the long format of day name (like Sunday ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Depth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the maximum level of views such as a month, year, and decade in the calendar.
            <para>The depth view should be smaller than the start view to restrict its view navigation.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: KeyConfigs
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Customizes the key actions in the calendar.
            <para>For example, when using a German keyboard, the key actions can be customized using these shortcuts.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Start
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the initial view of the calendar when it is opened. With the help of this property, the initial view can be changed to the year or decade view.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ServerTimezoneOffset
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            By default, the date value will be processed based on the system time zone.
            <para>If you want to process the initial date value using the server time zone then specify the time zone value to the ServerTimezoneOffset property.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowTodayButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether the today button will be displayed in the calendar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: WeekNumber
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether the week number of the year will be displayed in the calendar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: WeekRule
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the rule for defining the first week of the year.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnChange
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the content of input has changed and gets focus-out.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnInput
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers each time when the value of input has changed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnPaste
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the content is paste into an input.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnBlur
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input has focus-out.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnFocus
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input gets focus.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the id of the TextBox component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Value
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the content of the TextBox.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the callback to trigger when the value changes.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueExpression
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the expression for defining the value of the bound.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the TextBox. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a TextBox.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable the persisting TextBox state between page reloads. If enabled, the `Value` state will be persisted.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable rendering component in the right to left direction.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the TextBox allows the user to interact with it.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValidateOnInput
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the component validates the input or not. true, If the ValidateOnInput is enabled for form validation, then the model value will be updated on entering the value to the input. otherwise, false.The default value is false. This property is used to validate the form on typing into the input and updating the model value. The ValueChange event will be fired after the component lost its focus.

            <description>Sets the short format of day name (like Su ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Narrow</term>
            <description>Sets the single character of day name (like S ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Abbreviated</term>
            <description>Sets the min format of day name (like Sun ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Wide</term>
            <description>Sets the long format of day name (like Sunday ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.MaskPlaceholder
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.MaskPlaceholder" /> property is used to set the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder in an input field until the user enters a value. 
            It can be used to provide additional context or instructions to the user about the format that is expected for the input.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
             The <c>MaskPlaceholder</c> class properties will work when enabling the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.EnableMask" /> property.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Day
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder until the user enters a value in the day segment of the date input.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>Null</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property is typically used with input fields that have a date mask, which is a predefined <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Format" /> that constrains the user's input. 
            For example, a date mask might require that the user enter a date in the format <c>mm/dd/yyyy</c>, with the day segment being the <c>dd</c> part of the format. 
            In this case, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.MaskPlaceholder.Day" /> property might be set to <c>dd</c> to indicate to the user the expected format of the day that they should enter.
            </remarks>

            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: DayHeaderFormat
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the format of the day that to be displayed in the header. By default, the format is short.
            <para>Possible formats are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Short</term>
            <description>Sets the short format of day name (like Su ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Narrow</term>
            <description>Sets the single character of day name (like S ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Abbreviated</term>
            <description>Sets the min format of day name (like Sun ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Wide</term>
            <description>Sets the long format of day name (like Sunday ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValidateOnInput
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the component validates the input or not. true, If the ValidateOnInput is enabled for form validation, then the model value will be updated on entering the value to the input. otherwise, false.The default value is false. This property is used to validate the form on typing into the input and updating the model value. The ValueChange event will be fired after the component lost its focus.

<summary>

            </summary>
            <summary>

            </summary>
            <summary>

            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsMultiSelection
BoundAttributes.Documentation:

            Specifies the boolean value whether the calendar allows the user to select the multiple dates.
            </summary>

            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional html attributes such as styles, class etc., to the root element.
            <para>If you configured both property and equivalent html attribute, then the component considers the property value.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Max
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a maximum date that is allowed a user can select in the calendar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Min
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a minimum date that is allowed a user can select in the calendar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FirstDayOfWeek
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the calendar's first day of the week. By default, the first day of the week will be based on the current culture.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CalendarMode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the calendar's type like Gregorian.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: DayHeaderFormat
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the format of the day that to be displayed in the header. By default, the format is short.
            <para>Possible formats are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Short</term>
            <description>Sets the short format of day name (like Su ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Narrow</term>
            <description>Sets the single character of day name (like S ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Abbreviated</term>
            <description>Sets the min format of day name (like Sun ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Wide</term>
            <description>Sets the long format of day name (like Sunday ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Depth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the maximum level of views such as a month, year, and decade in the calendar.
            <para>The depth view should be smaller than the start view to restrict its view navigation.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: KeyConfigs
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Customizes the key actions in the calendar.
            <para>For example, when using a German keyboard, the key actions can be customized using these shortcuts.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Start
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the initial view of the calendar when it is opened. With the help of this property, the initial view can be changed to the year or decade view.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ServerTimezoneOffset
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            By default, the date value will be processed based on the system time zone.
            <para>If you want to process the initial date value using the server time zone then specify the time zone value to the ServerTimezoneOffset property.</para>
            </summary>

            </summary>

            </summary>

<summary>
            Specifies the rule for defining the first week of the year.
            </summary>

<summary>
            The DatePicker is a graphical user interface component that allows the user to select or enter a date value.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The DatePicker is a graphical user interface component that allows the user to select or enter a date value.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            Defines the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1" />.
            </summary>
            <typeparam name="TValue">Specifies the type of SfDatePicker.</typeparam>
            <summary>
            The DatePicker is a graphical user interface component that allows the user to select or enter a date value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: TValue
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TValue for the Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker<TValue> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the content that has to be passed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowEdit
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a boolean value to <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.AllowEdit" /> whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1" /> allows user to change the value via typing. 
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the DatePicker allows user to change the value via typing; otherwise, <c>false</c>  user to change the value via picker only. The default value is <c>true</c>.        
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableMask
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets mask rendering in the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the component render with mask format; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.        
            </value>
            <remarks>
            The Enable mask property restricts the user to type the unwanted characters in the text area. It allows only eligible characters to type.        
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.FloatLabelType" /> behavior of the DatePicker that the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Placeholder" /> text floats above the DatePicker based on the following values.
            <para>Possible values are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Never</term>
            <description>Never floats the label in the DatePicker when the placeholder is available.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Always</term>
            <description>The floating label always floats above the DatePicker.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Auto</term>
            <description>The floating label floats above the DatePicker after focusing it or when enters the value in it.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Format
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Format" /> of the value that to be displayed in component.
            <para>By default, the format is based on the culture.</para>
            <para>You can set the format to "format:'dd/MM/yyyy hh:mm'".</para>
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts format value in string type. The default culture format is <c>M/d/yyyy</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the additional <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.HtmlAttributes" /> such as styles, class, and more to the root element.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Additional attributes can be added by specifying an inline attribute or by specifying @attributes directive.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: InputAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the additional <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.InputAttributes" /> such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
            </summary>
            <remarks>       
            If you configured both property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Placeholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text that is shown as a hint or <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Placeholder" /> until the user focuses or enter a value in DatePicker.
            </summary>
            <value>
             Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>string.Empty</c>
            </value>
            <remarks> 
             The property is depending on the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.FloatLabelType" /> property.        
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Readonly
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the boolean value to <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Readonly" /> whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1" /> allows the user to change the text.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the DatePicker value cannot be edited; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.  
            </value>
            <remark>
            If the read-only is enabled, the popup cannot open.
            </remark>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowClearButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a boolean value to <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.ShowClearButton" /> this indicates whether the clear button is displayed in <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the clear icon was shown; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.        
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: StrictMode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the component to act as strict So that it allows to enter of only a valid date value within a specified range, or else it will reset to the previous value.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if this property won't allow to enter an invalid date; otherwise, <c>false</c> It allows invalid or out-of-range date value with highlighted error class. The default value is <c>false</c>.        
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Width" /> of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>null</c>
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ZIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.ZIndex" /> value of the DatePicker popup element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts integer value. The default value is <c>1000</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: TabIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.TabIndex" /> order of the DatePicker component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts integer value. The default value is <c>0</c>.
            </value>

            Gets or sets the boolean value to <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Readonly" /> whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1" /> allows the user to change the text.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the DatePicker value cannot be edited; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.  
            </value>
            <remark>
            If the read-only is enabled, the popup cannot open.
            </remark>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowClearButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a boolean value to <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.ShowClearButton" /> this indicates whether the clear button is displayed in <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the clear icon was shown; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.        
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: StrictMode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the component to act as strict So that it allows to enter of only a valid date value within a specified range, or else it will reset to the previous value.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if this property won't allow to enter an invalid date; otherwise, <c>false</c> It allows invalid or out-of-range date value with highlighted error class. The default value is <c>false</c>.        
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Width" /> of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>null</c>
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ZIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.ZIndex" /> value of the DatePicker popup element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts integer value. The default value is <c>1000</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: TabIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.TabIndex" /> order of the DatePicker component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts integer value. The default value is <c>0</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Max
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a maximum date that is allowed a user can select in the calendar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Min
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a minimum date that is allowed a user can select in the calendar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FirstDayOfWeek
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the calendar's first day of the week. By default, the first day of the week will be based on the current culture.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CalendarMode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the calendar's type like Gregorian.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: DayHeaderFormat
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the format of the day that to be displayed in the header. By default, the format is short.
            <para>Possible formats are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Short</term>
            <description>Sets the short format of day name (like Su ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Narrow</term>
            <description>Sets the single character of day name (like S ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Abbreviated</term>
            <description>Sets the min format of day name (like Sun ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Wide</term>
            <description>Sets the long format of day name (like Sunday ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Depth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the maximum level of views such as a month, year, and decade in the calendar.
            <para>The depth view should be smaller than the start view to restrict its view navigation.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: KeyConfigs
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Customizes the key actions in the calendar.
            <para>For example, when using a German keyboard, the key actions can be customized using these shortcuts.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Start
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the initial view of the calendar when it is opened. With the help of this property, the initial view can be changed to the year or decade view.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ServerTimezoneOffset
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            By default, the date value will be processed based on the system time zone.
            <para>If you want to process the initial date value using the server time zone then specify the time zone value to the ServerTimezoneOffset property.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowTodayButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether the today button will be displayed in the calendar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: WeekNumber
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether the week number of the year will be displayed in the calendar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: WeekRule
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the rule for defining the first week of the year.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValidateOnInput
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the component validates the input or not. true, If the ValidateOnInput is enabled for form validation, then the model value will be updated on entering the value to the input. otherwise, false.The default value is false. This property is used to validate the form on typing into the input and updating the model value. The ValueChange event will be fired after the component lost its focus.

BoundAttributes.Name: Day
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder until the user enters a value in the day segment of the date input.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>Null</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property is typically used with input fields that have a date mask, which is a predefined <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Format" /> that constrains the user's input. 
            For example, a date mask might require that the user enter a date in the format <c>mm/dd/yyyy</c>, with the day segment being the <c>dd</c> part of the format. 
            In this case, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.MaskPlaceholder.Day" /> property might be set to <c>dd</c> to indicate to the user the expected format of the day that they should enter.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: EndDateChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when end date of the DateRangePicker is changed.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the floating label behavior of the DateRangePicker that the placeholder text floats above the DateRangePicker based on the following values.
            <para>Possible values are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Never</term>
            <description>Never floats the label in the DateRangePicker when the placeholder is available.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Always</term>
            <description>The floating label always floats above the DateRangePicker.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Auto</term>
            <description>The floating label floats above the DateRangePicker after focusing it or when enters the value in it.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Format
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the required date format to the start and end date string.
            <para>By default, the format is based on the culture.</para>
            <para>You can set the format to "format:'dd/MM/yyyy hh:mm'".</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional html attributes such as styles, class, and more to the root element.
            If you configured both property and equivalent html attributes, then the component considers the property value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>

            If you configured both property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: MaxDays
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
             Gets or sets the maximum span of days that can be allowed in a date range selection.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: MinDays
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
             Gets or sets the minimum span of days that can be allowed in date range selection.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Placeholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>

            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Readonly
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a boolean value whether the DateRangePicker allows the user to change the text.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Separator
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets or gets the string that used between the start and end date string.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowClearButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether to show or hide the clear icon in DateRangePicker.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: StartDate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:

BoundAttributes.Name: StrictMode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the DateRangePicker to act as strict. So that, it allows to enter only a valid date value within a specified range or else it will resets to previous value.
            <para> By default, StrictMode is in false. It allows invalid or out-of-range date value with highlighted error class.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:

BoundAttributes.Documentation:

            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Min
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a minimum date that is allowed a user can select in the calendar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FirstDayOfWeek
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the calendar's first day of the week. By default, the first day of the week will be based on the current culture.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CalendarMode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the calendar's type like Gregorian.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: DayHeaderFormat
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the format of the day that to be displayed in the header. By default, the format is short.
            <para>Possible formats are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Short</term>
            <description>Sets the short format of day name (like Su ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Narrow</term>
            <description>Sets the single character of day name (like S ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Abbreviated</term>
            <description>Sets the min format of day name (like Sun ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Wide</term>
            <description>Sets the long format of day name (like Sunday ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Depth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the maximum level of views such as a month, year, and decade in the calendar.
            <para>The depth view should be smaller than the start view to restrict its view navigation.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: KeyConfigs
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Customizes the key actions in the calendar.
            <para>For example, when using a German keyboard, the key actions can be customized using these shortcuts.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Start
BoundAttributes.Documentation:

This property is used to validate the form on typing into the input and updating the model value. The ValueChange event will be fired after the component lost its focus.

BoundAttributes.Name: Day
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder until the user enters a value in the day segment of the date input.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>Null</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property is typically used with input fields that have a date mask, which is a predefined <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Format" /> that constrains the user's input. 
            For example, a date mask might require that the user enter a date in the format <c>mm/dd/yyyy</c>, with the day segment being the <c>dd</c> part of the format. 
            In this case, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.MaskPlaceholder.Day" /> property might be set to <c>dd</c> to indicate to the user the expected format of the day that they should enter.
            </remarks>
