TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDateTimePicker<TValue>
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The DateTimePicker is a graphical user interface component that allows the user to select or enter a date value.
            </summary>
            <typeparam name="TValue">Specifies the type of SfDateTimePicker.</typeparam>
            <summary>
            The DateTimePicker is a graphical user interface component that allows to select a date and time value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: TValue
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TValue for the Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDateTimePicker<TValue> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: ScrollTo
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the scroll bar position, if there is no value is selected in the DateTimePicker popup list or
            the given value is not present in the DateTimePicker popup list.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Max
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the maximum time value that can be allowed to select in DateTimePicker.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Min
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the minimum time value that can be allowed to select in DateTimePicker.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Step
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the time interval between the two adjacent time values in the time popup list .
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: TimeFormat
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the format of the time value that to be displayed in time popup list.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnKeyDown
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input gets keydown.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the content that has to be passed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowEdit
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a boolean value to <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.AllowEdit" /> whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1" /> allows user to change the value via typing. 
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the DatePicker allows user to change the value via typing; otherwise, <c>false</c>  user to change the value via picker only. The default value is <c>true</c>.        
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableMask
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets mask rendering in the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the component render with mask format; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.        
            </value>
            <remarks>
            The Enable mask property restricts the user to type the unwanted characters in the text area. It allows only eligible characters to type.        
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.FloatLabelType" /> behavior of the DatePicker that the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Placeholder" /> text floats above the DatePicker based on the following values.
            <para>Possible values are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Never</term>
            <description>Never floats the label in the DatePicker when the placeholder is available.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Always</term>
            <description>The floating label always floats above the DatePicker.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Auto</term>
            <description>The floating label floats above the DatePicker after focusing it or when enters the value in it.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Format
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Format" /> of the value that to be displayed in component.
            <para>By default, the format is based on the culture.</para>
            <para>You can set the format to "format:'dd/MM/yyyy hh:mm'".</para>
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts format value in string type. The default culture format is <c>M/d/yyyy</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the additional <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.HtmlAttributes" /> such as styles, class, and more to the root element.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Additional attributes can be added by specifying an inline attribute or by specifying @attributes directive.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: InputAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the additional <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.InputAttributes" /> such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
            </summary>
            <remarks>       
            If you configured both property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Placeholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text that is shown as a hint or <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Placeholder" /> until the user focuses or enter a value in DatePicker.
            </summary>
            <value>
             Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>string.Empty</c>
            </value>
            <remarks> 
             The property is depending on the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.FloatLabelType" /> property.        
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Readonly
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the boolean value to <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Readonly" /> whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1" /> allows the user to change the text.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the DatePicker value cannot be edited; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.  
            </value>
            <remark>
            If the read-only is enabled, the popup cannot open.
            </remark>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowClearButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a boolean value to <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.ShowClearButton" /> this indicates whether the clear button is displayed in <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the clear icon was shown; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.        
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: StrictMode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the component to act as strict So that it allows to enter of only a valid date value within a specified range, or else it will reset to the previous value.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if this property won't allow to enter an invalid date; otherwise, <c>false</c> It allows invalid or out-of-range date value with highlighted error class. The default value is <c>false</c>.        
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Width" /> of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>null</c>
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ZIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.ZIndex" /> value of the DatePicker popup element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts integer value. The default value is <c>1000</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: TabIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.TabIndex" /> order of the DatePicker component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts integer value. The default value is <c>0</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: FirstDayOfWeek
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the calendar's first day of the week. By default, the first day of the week will be based on the current culture.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CalendarMode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the calendar's type like Gregorian.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: DayHeaderFormat
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the format of the day that to be displayed in the header. By default, the format is short.
            <para>Possible formats are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Short</term>
            <description>Sets the short format of day name (like Su ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Narrow</term>
            <description>Sets the single character of day name (like S ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Abbreviated</term>
            <description>Sets the min format of day name (like Sun ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Wide</term>
            <description>Sets the long format of day name (like Sunday ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Depth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the maximum level of views such as a month, year, and decade in the calendar.
            <para>The depth view should be smaller than the start view to restrict its view navigation.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: KeyConfigs
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Customizes the key actions in the calendar.
            <para>For example, when using a German keyboard, the key actions can be customized using these shortcuts.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Start
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the initial view of the calendar when it is opened. With the help of this property, the initial view can be changed to the year or decade view.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ServerTimezoneOffset
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            By default, the date value will be processed based on the system time zone.
            <para>If you want to process the initial date value using the server time zone then specify the time zone value to the ServerTimezoneOffset property.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowTodayButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether the today button will be displayed in the calendar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: WeekNumber
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether the week number of the year will be displayed in the calendar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: WeekRule
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the rule for defining the first week of the year.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnChange
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the content of input has changed and gets focus-out.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnInput
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers each time when the value of input has changed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnPaste
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the content is paste into an input.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnBlur
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input has focus-out.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnFocus
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input gets focus.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the id of the TextBox component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Value
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the content of the TextBox.
            </summary>

<summary>
            Specifies the callback to trigger when the value changes.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueExpression
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the expression for defining the value of the bound.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the TextBox. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a TextBox.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable the persisting TextBox state between page reloads. If enabled, the `Value` state will be persisted.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable rendering component in the right to left direction.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the TextBox allows the user to interact with it.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValidateOnInput
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the component validates the input or not. true, If the ValidateOnInput is enabled for form validation, then the model value will be updated on entering the value to the input. otherwise, false.The default value is false. This property is used to validate the form on typing into the input and updating the model value. The ValueChange event will be fired after the component lost its focus.

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.FloatLabelType" /> behavior of the DatePicker that the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Placeholder" /> text floats above the DatePicker based on the following values.
            <para>Possible values are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Never</term>
            <description>Never floats the label in the DatePicker when the placeholder is available.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Always</term>
            <description>The floating label always floats above the DatePicker.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Auto</term>
            <description>The floating label floats above the DatePicker after focusing it or when enters the value in it.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>

            <para>By default, the format is based on the culture.</para>
            <para>You can set the format to "format:'dd/MM/yyyy hh:mm'".</para>
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts format value in string type. The default culture format is <c>M/d/yyyy</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: DayHeaderFormat

<summary>

            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Short</term>
            <description>Sets the short format of day name (like Su ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Narrow</term>
            <description>Sets the single character of day name (like S ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Abbreviated</term>
            <description>Sets the min format of day name (like Sun ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Wide</term>
            <description>Sets the long format of day name (like Sunday ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

            Gets or sets the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfTimePicker`1.FloatLabelType" /> behavior of the TextBox that the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfTimePicker`1.Placeholder" /> text floats above the TextBox based on the following values.
            <para>Possible values are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Never</term>
            <description>Never floats the label in the TextBox when the placeholder is available.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Always</term>
            <description>The floating label always floats above the TextBox.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Auto</term>
            <description>The floating label floats above the TextBox after focusing it or when enters the value in it.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Placeholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text that is shown as a hint or <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfTimePicker`1.Placeholder" /> until the user focuses or enter a value in TimePicker.
            </summary>
            <value>
             Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>string.Empty</c>
            </value>
            <remarks> 
             The property is depending on the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfTimePicker`1.FloatLabelType" /> property.        
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Readonly
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the boolean value to <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfTimePicker`1.Readonly" /> whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfTimePicker`1" /> allows the user to change the text.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the TimePicker value cannot be edited; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.  
            </value>
            <remark>
            If the read-only is enabled, the popup cannot open.
            </remark>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableMask
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets mask rendering in the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfTimePicker`1" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the component render with mask format; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.        
            </value>
            <remarks>
            The Enable mask property restricts the user to type the unwanted characters in the text area. It allows only eligible characters to type.        
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowClearButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a boolean value to <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfTimePicker`1.ShowClearButton" /> this indicates whether the clear button is displayed in <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfTimePicker`1" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the clear icon was shown; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the additional <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfTimePicker`1.HtmlAttributes" /> such as styles, class, and more to the root element.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Additional attributes can be added by specifying an inline attribute or by specifying @attributes directive.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: InputAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the additional <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfTimePicker`1.InputAttributes" /> such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
            </summary>
            <remarks>       
            If you configured both property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfTimePicker`1.Width" /> of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfTimePicker`1" /> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: TabIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfTimePicker`1.TabIndex" /> order of the TimePicker component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts integer value. The default value is <c>0</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Format
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the required time <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfTimePicker`1.Format" /> of value that is to be displayed in component.
            <para>By default, the format is based on the culture.</para>
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts format value in string type. The default culture format is <c>h:mm tt</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: KeyConfigs
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Customizes the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfTimePicker`1.KeyConfigs" /> in <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfTimePicker`1" /> component. 
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            When using German keyboard, the key actions can be customized using these shortcuts.
            </remarks>

            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Min
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>

            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ScrollTo
BoundAttributes.Documentation:

            <value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Step
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the time interval. This time interval between the two adjacent time values in the popup list.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a integer value. The default value is <c>30</c>.        
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: StrictMode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the component to act as strict So that it allows to enter of only a valid date value within a specified range, or else it will reset to the previous value.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if this property won't allow to enter an invalid date; otherwise, <c>false</c> It allows invalid or out-of-range date value with highlighted error class. The default value is <c>false</c>.        
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ZIndex

            </summary>

            </value>

This property is used to validate the form on typing into the input and updating the model value. The ValueChange event will be fired after the component lost its focus.

BoundAttributes.Name: Day
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder until the user enters a value in the day segment of the date input.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>Null</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property is typically used with input fields that have a date mask, which is a predefined <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Format" /> that constrains the user's input. 
            For example, a date mask might require that the user enter a date in the format <c>mm/dd/yyyy</c>, with the day segment being the <c>dd</c> part of the format. 
            In this case, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.MaskPlaceholder.Day" /> property might be set to <c>dd</c> to indicate to the user the expected format of the day that they should enter.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: DayHeaderFormat
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the format of the day that to be displayed in the header. By default, the format is short.
            <para>Possible formats are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Short</term>
            <description>Sets the short format of day name (like Su ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Narrow</term>
            <description>Sets the single character of day name (like S ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Abbreviated</term>
            <description>Sets the min format of day name (like Sun ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Wide</term>
            <description>Sets the long format of day name (like Sunday ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: DayHeaderFormat
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the format of the day that to be displayed in the header. By default, the format is short.
            <para>Possible formats are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Short</term>
            <description>Sets the short format of day name (like Su ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Narrow</term>
            <description>Sets the single character of day name (like S ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Abbreviated</term>
            <description>Sets the min format of day name (like Sun ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Wide</term>
            <description>Sets the long format of day name (like Sunday ) in day header.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Depth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the maximum level of views such as a month, year, and decade in the calendar.
            <para>The depth view should be smaller than the start view to restrict its view navigation.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: KeyConfigs
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Customizes the key actions in the calendar.
            <para>For example, when using a German keyboard, the key actions can be customized using these shortcuts.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Start
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the initial view of the calendar when it is opened. With the help of this property, the initial view can be changed to the year or decade view.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ServerTimezoneOffset
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            By default, the date value will be processed based on the system time zone.
            <para>If you want to process the initial date value using the server time zone then specify the time zone value to the ServerTimezoneOffset property.</para>
            </summary>

This property is used to validate the form on typing into the input and updating the model value. The ValueChange event will be fired after the component lost its focus.

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfColorPicker
TagHelpers.Documentation: ColorPicker component is a user interface to select and adjust color values. It provides supports for various color specification like Red Green Blue, Hue Saturation Value and Hex codes. ColorPicker is a user interface to select and adjust color values. It provides supports for various color specification like Red Green Blue, Hue Saturation Value and Hex codes. ColorPicker is a user interface to select and adjust color values. It provides supports for various color specification like Red Green Blue, Hue Saturation Value and Hex codes. ColorPicker component is a user interface to select and adjust color values. It provides supports for various color specification like Red Green Blue, Hue Saturation Value and Hex codes. In the below code example, showcases a basic ColorPicker component. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation: <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<exclude />
            <summary> 
            Gets or sets a a value that indicates the collection of additional attributes that will applied to the color picker container element. 
            </summary> 
            <remarks> 
            Additional attributes can be added by specifying as inline attributes or by specifying <c>@attributes</c> directive. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Columns
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the columns to be rendered in palette mode. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a double value. The default value is <c>10</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates CSS class string to customize the appearance of color picker. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance of color picker. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Disabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the color picker. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the button component is disabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableOpacity
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the opacity slider. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the opacity slider is enabled. The default value is <c>true</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to persist component's state between page reloads. When set to <c>true</c>, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfColorPicker.Value" /> property is persisted. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the component's state persistence is enabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            Component's <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfColorPicker.Value" /> property will be stored in browser local storage to persist component's state when page reloads. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the right to left direction. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction is enabled for the component. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Inline
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable to disable the inlide mode color picker. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the color picker component is rendered as inline. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Mode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the mode of color picker to be rendered. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.ColorPickerMode" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.ColorPickerMode.Picker" /> 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>ColorPickerMode</c> is <c>Picker</c>, the color picker is rendered as a picker. 
            If the <c>ColorPickerMode</c> is <c>Palette</c>, the color picker is rendered as a palette. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ModeSwitcher
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the mode switcher option. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the mode switcher option is enabled. The default value is <c>true</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: NoColor
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the no color option. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the no color option is enabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            No color option is only available in palette mode. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: PresetColors
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the collection of custom color values that will be rendered as color picker element. 
            </summary> 
            <remarks> 
            Preset colors option is only available in palette mode. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowButtons
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the apply/cancel buttons. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the apply/cancel buttons were enabled. The default value is <c>true</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Value
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets the color value for color picker. It should be specified as Hex code. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>#008000ff</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfColorPicker" /> color value changed.  
            </summary> 
            <remarks> 
            You can access the Color Picker item related values using <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.ColorPickerEventArgs" />. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueExpression
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the expression for defining the value of the bound.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfColorPicker" /> popup is closing.  
            </summary> 
            <remarks> 
            You can access the color picker popup related values using <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.BeforeOpenCloseEventArgs" />.

BoundAttributes.Name: OnModeSwitch
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised before the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfColorPicker" /> mode switching is performed.  
            </summary> 
            <remarks> 
            You can access the Color Picker item related values using <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.ModeSwitchEventArgs" />. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ModeSwitched
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfColorPicker" /> mode switch performed.  
            </summary> 
            <remarks> 
            You can access the Color Picker item related values using <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.ModeSwitchEventArgs" />. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnTileRender
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfColorPicker" /> tile rendering is completed.  
            </summary> 
            <remarks> 
            You can customize the color picker tile rendering using <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.PaletteTileEventArgs" />. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueChange
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised  while changing the colors.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            It will be triggered based on the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfColorPicker.ShowButtons" /> property.
            If the property is false, this event will be triggered while selecting the colors.
            If the property is true, this event will be triggered while apply the selected color.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Selected
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfColorPicker" /> palette or picker element is clicked.  
            </summary> 
            <remarks> 
            You can access the Color Picker item related values using <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.ColorPickerEventArgs" />. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Created
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfColorPicker" /> rendering is completed.  
            </summary>

            Gets or sets a a value that indicates the collection of additional attributes that will applied to the color picker container element. 
            </summary> 
            <remarks> 
            Additional attributes can be added by specifying as inline attributes or by specifying <c>@attributes</c> directive. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Columns
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the columns to be rendered in palette mode. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a double value. The default value is <c>10</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates CSS class string to customize the appearance of color picker. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance of color picker. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Disabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the color picker. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the button component is disabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableOpacity
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the opacity slider. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the opacity slider is enabled. The default value is <c>true</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to persist component's state between page reloads. When set to <c>true</c>, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfColorPicker.Value" /> property is persisted. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the component's state persistence is enabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            Component's <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfColorPicker.Value" /> property will be stored in browser local storage to persist component's state when page reloads. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the right to left direction. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction is enabled for the component. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Inline
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable to disable the inlide mode color picker. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the color picker component is rendered as inline. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Mode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the mode of color picker to be rendered. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.ColorPickerMode" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.ColorPickerMode.Picker" /> 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>ColorPickerMode</c> is <c>Picker</c>, the color picker is rendered as a picker. 
            If the <c>ColorPickerMode</c> is <c>Palette</c>, the color picker is rendered as a palette. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ModeSwitcher
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the mode switcher option. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the mode switcher option is enabled. The default value is <c>true</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: NoColor
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the no color option. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the no color option is enabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            No color option is only available in palette mode. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: PresetColors
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the collection of custom color values that will be rendered as color picker element. 
            </summary> 
            <remarks> 
            Preset colors option is only available in palette mode. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowButtons
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the apply/cancel buttons. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the apply/cancel buttons were enabled. The default value is <c>true</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Value
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets the color value for color picker. It should be specified as Hex code. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>#008000ff</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfColorPicker" /> color value changed.  
            </summary> 
            <remarks> 
            You can access the Color Picker item related values using <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.ColorPickerEventArgs" />. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueExpression
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the expression for defining the value of the bound.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnOpen
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the popup is opening. you can access the ColorPicker popup related values using . @code { private void OnOpen(BeforeOpenCloseEventArgs args) { // Write your code here. } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Opened
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the popup is opened. You can access the SplitButton popup related values using . @code { private void Opened(OpenEventArgs args) { // Write your code here. } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnClose
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfColorPicker" /> popup is closing.  
            </summary> 
            <remarks> 
            You can access the color picker popup related values using <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.BeforeOpenCloseEventArgs" />. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnModeSwitch
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised before the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfColorPicker" /> mode switching is performed.  
            </summary> 
            <remarks> 
            You can access the Color Picker item related values using <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.ModeSwitchEventArgs" />. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ModeSwitched
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfColorPicker" /> mode switch performed.  
            </summary> 
            <remarks> 
            You can access the Color Picker item related values using <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.ModeSwitchEventArgs" />. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnTileRender
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfColorPicker" /> tile rendering is completed.  
            </summary> 
            <remarks> 
            You can customize the color picker tile rendering using <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.PaletteTileEventArgs" />. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueChange
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised  while changing the colors.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            It will be triggered based on the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfColorPicker.ShowButtons" /> property.
            If the property is false, this event will be triggered while selecting the colors.
            If the property is true, this event will be triggered while apply the selected color.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Selected
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfColorPicker" /> palette or picker element is clicked.  
            </summary> 
            <remarks> 
            You can access the Color Picker item related values using <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.ColorPickerEventArgs" />. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Created
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfColorPicker" /> rendering is completed.  
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:

            Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the SfMaskedTextBox allows the user to interact with it.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the floating label behavior of the SfMaskedTextBox that the placeholder text floats above the SfMaskedTextBox based on the following values.
            <para>Possible values are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Never</term>
            <description>Never floats the label in the SfMaskedTextBox when the placeholder is available.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Always</term>
            <description>The floating label always floats above the SfMaskedTextBox.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Auto</term>
            <description>The floating label floats above the SfMaskedTextBox after focusing it or when enters the value in it.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:

            If you configured both property and equivalent html attributes, then the component considers the property value.
            </summary>

            "P" , "A" , "p" , "a" and "M" accepts values "M", "m" mentioned in the custom characters collection.</para>
            </summary>

            <item>
            <term>Always</term>
            <description>The floating label always floats above the TextBox.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Auto</term>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfRating
TagHelpers.Documentation: The Blazor Rating component allows the user to rate something by clicking on a set of symbols on numeric scale. This allow users to provide feedback or ratings for products, services, or content. A simple Blazor Rating component with value. ]]> A Blazor Rating component with label. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowReset
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to show or hide the reset button in a rating component.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, the reset button will be visible to the user and they will be able to click it to reset the rating value to its default. 
            The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets one or more CSS classes that can be used to customize the appearance of a rating component.
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One or more CSS classes to customize the appearance of the rating component, such as by changing its colors, fonts, sizes, or other visual aspects.
            The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Disabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that specifies whether a rating component is enabled or disabled.
            A disabled rating component may have a different visual appearance than an enabled one.
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, the rating component will be disabled and the user will not be able to interact with it. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EmptyTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a template that defines the appearance of each un-rated item in a rating component. The is passed as a context to the template, allowing it to access information about the un-rated item, such as its and . The template content. The default value is null. Rating with empty template. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableAnimation
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to add animation (to provide visual feedback to the user) when an item in a rating component is hovered.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, an animation will be added when the user hovers their cursor over an item in the rating component.
            The default value is <c>true</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableSingleSelection
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to select all the items before the selected item should be in selected state in a rating component.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, only the selected item will be in the selected state, and all other items will be un-selected.
            <c>false</c>, all items before the selected one will be in the selected state.
            The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: FullTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a template that defines the appearance of each rated item in a rating component. The is passed as a context to the template, allowing it to access information about the rated item, such as its and . The template content. The default value is null. Rating with full template. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets id attribute for the rating element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ItemsCount
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that specifies the number of items (symbols) in rating component.
            The rating component typically consists of a number of items, such as stars or other symbols, that represent the rating value. 
            </summary>
            <value>
            An int that specifies the number of items (symbols) displayed in rating component
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: LabelPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets the the position of the label in rating component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.LabelPosition" /> enumeration that specifies the position of the label. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.LabelPosition.Right" />.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            You can use this property to customize the position of the label within the rating component to suit the needs of your application. 
            For example, you can set the <c>LabelPosition</c> property to ,<c>Top</c> to position the label at the top center of the rating component, 
            or set it to <c>Left</c> to position the label at the left side of the component.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: LabelTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a template that used as label over default label of the rating. The current value of rating passed as context to build the content. The template content. The default value is null. Rating with label template. @context Out Of 5 ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Min
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets the value that specifies minimum rating that a user can select.
            </summary>
            <value>
            By default, the <c>Min</c> property is set to 0, which means that the minimum possible rating is 0.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            You can use the <c>Min</c> property to customize the minimum possible rating in the <c>SfRating</c> component. 
            For example, if you want to allow users to provide ratings from 1 to 5, you can set the <c>Min</c> property to 1 and <c>ItemsCount</c> to 5.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Precision
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the precision type of the rating which used to component the granularity of the rating, allowing users to provide ratings with varying levels of precision. One of the enumeration that specifies the precision type. The default value is . The Precision property can be set to one of the following values: * Full: The rating is increased in whole number increments. For example, if the current rating is 3, the next possible ratings are 4, 5, and so on. * Half: The rating is increased in increments of 0.5 (half). For example, if the current rating is 3.5, the next possible ratings are 4, 4.5, 5, and so on. * Quarter: The rating is increased in increments of 0.25 (quarter). For example, if the current rating is 3.75, the next possible ratings are 4, 4.25, 4.5, and so on. * Exact: The rating is increased in increments of 0.1. For example, if the current rating is 3.9, the next possible ratings are 4, 4.1, 4.2, and so on.

BoundAttributes.Name: ReadOnly
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a boolean value that specifies whether the read-only mode is enabled for a rating component, 
            which means that the user will be able to interact with it and change the rating value. 
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>,the rating component will be in read-only mode, which means that the user will not be able to interact with it and change the rating value. 
            The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowLabel
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to display a label that shows the current value of a rating.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, a label will be displayed that shows the current value of the rating; otherwise false. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowTooltip
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that defines whether to show tooltip for the items.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, show tooltip for the items. The default value is <c>true</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: TooltipTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets a template that used as tooltip content over default tooltip content of the rating. The current value of rating passed as context to build the content. The template content. The default value is null. Rating with tooltip template.
@context Star
 ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Value
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the current rating value which used to display and update the rating selected by the user. Based on , users can select ratings with varying levels of precision The Value property is a decimal value that ranges from the to the , as specified by the Min and ItemsCount properties of the rating. You can use the Value property to initialize the rating component with a specific rating value, or to get the current rating value selected by the user. For example, if you want to initialize the rating component with a rating of 3.5, you can set the Value property to 3.5.

BoundAttributes.Name: Visible
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the rating component is visible or hidden
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the rating component is visible. The default value is <c>true</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Created
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfRating" /> rendering is completed.  
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnItemHover
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when a user hovers over an item.   
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfRating.Value" /> property is changed.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfRating
TagHelpers.Documentation: The Blazor Rating component allows the user to rate something by clicking on a set of symbols on numeric scale. This allow users to provide feedback or ratings for products, services, or content. A simple Blazor Rating component with value. ]]> A Blazor Rating component with label. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowReset
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to show or hide the reset button in a rating component.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, the reset button will be visible to the user and they will be able to click it to reset the rating value to its default. 
            The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets one or more CSS classes that can be used to customize the appearance of a rating component.
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One or more CSS classes to customize the appearance of the rating component, such as by changing its colors, fonts, sizes, or other visual aspects.
            The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Disabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that specifies whether a rating component is enabled or disabled.
            A disabled rating component may have a different visual appearance than an enabled one.
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, the rating component will be disabled and the user will not be able to interact with it. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EmptyTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a template that defines the appearance of each un-rated item in a rating component. The is passed as a context to the template, allowing it to access information about the un-rated item, such as its and . The template content. The default value is null. Rating with empty template. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableAnimation
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to add animation (to provide visual feedback to the user) when an item in a rating component is hovered.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, an animation will be added when the user hovers their cursor over an item in the rating component.
            The default value is <c>true</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableSingleSelection
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to select all the items before the selected item should be in selected state in a rating component.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, only the selected item will be in the selected state, and all other items will be un-selected.
            <c>false</c>, all items before the selected one will be in the selected state.
            The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: FullTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a template that defines the appearance of each rated item in a rating component. The is passed as a context to the template, allowing it to access information about the rated item, such as its and . The template content. The default value is null. Rating with full template. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets id attribute for the rating element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ItemsCount
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that specifies the number of items (symbols) in rating component.
            The rating component typically consists of a number of items, such as stars or other symbols, that represent the rating value. 
            </summary>
            <value>
            An int that specifies the number of items (symbols) displayed in rating component
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: LabelPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets the the position of the label in rating component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.LabelPosition" /> enumeration that specifies the position of the label. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.LabelPosition.Right" />.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            You can use this property to customize the position of the label within the rating component to suit the needs of your application. 
            For example, you can set the <c>LabelPosition</c> property to ,<c>Top</c> to position the label at the top center of the rating component, 
            or set it to <c>Left</c> to position the label at the left side of the component.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: LabelTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a template that used as label over default label of the rating. The current value of rating passed as context to build the content. The template content. The default value is null. Rating with label template. @context Out Of 5 ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Min
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets the value that specifies minimum rating that a user can select.
            </summary>
            <value>
            By default, the <c>Min</c> property is set to 0, which means that the minimum possible rating is 0.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            You can use the <c>Min</c> property to customize the minimum possible rating in the <c>SfRating</c> component. 
            For example, if you want to allow users to provide ratings from 1 to 5, you can set the <c>Min</c> property to 1 and <c>ItemsCount</c> to 5.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Precision
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the precision type of the rating which used to component the granularity of the rating, allowing users to provide ratings with varying levels of precision. One of the enumeration that specifies the precision type. The default value is . The Precision property can be set to one of the following values: * Full: The rating is increased in whole number increments. For example, if the current rating is 3, the next possible ratings are 4, 5, and so on. * Half: The rating is increased in increments of 0.5 (half). For example, if the current rating is 3.5, the next possible ratings are 4, 4.5, 5, and so on. * Quarter: The rating is increased in increments of 0.25 (quarter). For example, if the current rating is 3.75, the next possible ratings are 4, 4.25, 4.5, and so on. * Exact: The rating is increased in increments of 0.1. For example, if the current rating is 3.9, the next possible ratings are 4, 4.1, 4.2, and so on.

BoundAttributes.Name: ReadOnly
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a boolean value that specifies whether the read-only mode is enabled for a rating component, 
            which means that the user will be able to interact with it and change the rating value. 
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>,the rating component will be in read-only mode, which means that the user will not be able to interact with it and change the rating value. 
            The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowLabel
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to display a label that shows the current value of a rating.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, a label will be displayed that shows the current value of the rating; otherwise false. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowTooltip
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that defines whether to show tooltip for the items.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, show tooltip for the items. The default value is <c>true</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: TooltipTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets a template that used as tooltip content over default tooltip content of the rating. The current value of rating passed as context to build the content. The template content. The default value is null. Rating with tooltip template.
@context Star
 ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Value
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the current rating value which used to display and update the rating selected by the user. Based on , users can select ratings with varying levels of precision The Value property is a decimal value that ranges from the to the , as specified by the Min and ItemsCount properties of the rating. You can use the Value property to initialize the rating component with a specific rating value, or to get the current rating value selected by the user. For example, if you want to initialize the rating component with a rating of 3.5, you can set the Value property to 3.5.

BoundAttributes.Name: Visible
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the rating component is visible or hidden
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the rating component is visible. The default value is <c>true</c>. 
            </value>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature
TagHelpers.Documentation: Signature allows user to draw smooth signatures as vector outline of strokes using variable width Bzier curve interpolation. It allows to save signature as image. You can use your finger, pen, or mouse on a tablet, touchscreen, etc., to draw your own signature on this Signature component. Signature is a user interface to draw the signature or text. It supports stroke color, background color and image. In the below code example, a basic Signature initialized with tag directive. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes that will applied to the component. Additional attributes can be added as inline attributes or by specifying @attributes directive. In the below code example, signature height and width has been specified as style attribute in . ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: BackgroundColor
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the background color of the component. The background color of the component that accepts hex value, rgb and text (like red). The default value is null.

BoundAttributes.Name: BackgroundImage
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the background image for the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            An image that used to fill the background of the component. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Disabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to disable the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature" /> component where the opacity is set to show disabled state. 
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the signature component is disabled for user interaction. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsReadOnly
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to prevent the interaction in <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature" /> component. 
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the signature component is read only state where the user interaction is prevented. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: SaveWithBackground
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to save the signature along with <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature.BackgroundColor" /> and <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature.BackgroundImage" /> while saving. 
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if signature component to save with background. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: StrokeColor
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the stroke color of the signature. The color of the signature stroke that accepts hex value, rgb and text (like red). The default value is "#000000".

BoundAttributes.Name: MinStrokeWidth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the minimum stroke width for signature. 
            The <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature" /> component calculates stroke width based on <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature.Velocity" />, <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature.MinStrokeWidth" /> and <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature.MaxStrokeWidth" />.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The minimum width of stroke. The default value is <c>0.5</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: MaxStrokeWidth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the maximum stroke width for signature.
            The <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature" /> component calculates stroke width based on <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature.Velocity" />, <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature.MinStrokeWidth" /> and <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature.MaxStrokeWidth" />.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The maximum width of stroke. The default value is <c>2.0</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Velocity
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the velocity to calculate the stroke thickness based on the pressure of the contact on the digitizer surface.
            The Signature component calculates stroke thickness based on <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature.Velocity" />, <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature.MinStrokeWidth" /> and <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature.MaxStrokeWidth" />.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The velocity to calculate the stroke thickness based on the pressure of the contact on the digitizer surface. The default value is <c>0.7</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to persist component's state between page reloads.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the component's state persistence is enabled. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            Component's property will be stored in browser local storage to persist component's state when page reloads.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Changed
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised for the actions like undo, redo, clear and while user complete signing on component. @code { private void changefunc(SignatureChangeEventArgs args) { if (args.ActionName == "Clear") { // validation code goes here } } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnSave
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised while saving the signature. The file name and the file type(PNG, JPEG, SVG) can be changed using and . The event callback is raised only for the keyboard action (Ctrl + S). @code { private void beforesavefunc(SignatureSaveEventArgs args) { args.fileType = "SignatureFileType.Jpeg"; } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Created
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when component rendering is completed. You can load the pre-drawn signature when the signature component is created. In the below code example, the pre-drawn signature is loaded using Created event. @code { private void Created() { var sign = ""; // Base 64 or URL of the pre-drawn signature signature.LoadAsync(sign); } } ]]> Renders the base 64 string as signature on component. A Task that completes when the component has finished the loading of base 64 string. In the below code example, the pre-drawn signature is loaded using Created event. @code { private void Created() { var sign = ""; // Base 64 or URL of the pre-drawn signature signature.LoadAsync(sign, 400, 400); } } ]]>

            The Slider component allows the user to select a value or range of values
            in-between the min and max range, by dragging the handle over the slider bar.

BoundAttributes.Name: ID

<summary>
            Sets id attribute for the slider element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the ChildContent.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueExpression
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the expression for defining the value of the bound.
            </summary>
