BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the custom classes to be added to the element used to customize the slider.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CustomValues
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies an array of slider values in number or string type.
            The min and max step values are not considered.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableAnimation
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enables/Disables the animation for slider movement.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enables or disables the slider.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Max
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the maximum value of the slider.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Min
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the minimum value of the slider.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Orientation
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
             Specifies whether to render the slider in vertical or horizontal orientation.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ReadOnly
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether the render the slider in read-only mode to restrict any user interaction.
            The slider rendered with user defined values and cant be interacted with user actions.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowButtons
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether to show or hide the increase/decrease buttons
            of Slider to change the slider value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Step
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the step value for each value change when the increase / decrease
             button is clicked or on arrow keys press or on dragging the thumb.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Type
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Defines the type of the Slider. The available options are:
              Default - Allows to a single value in the Slider.
              MinRange - Allows to select a single value in the Slider. It displays a shadow from the start to the current value.
              Range - Allows to select a range of values in the Slider. It displays shadow in-between the selection range.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Value
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            It is used to denote the current value of the Slider.
            The value should be specified in array of number when render Slider type as range.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a callback of the bound value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the width of the Slider.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsImmediateValue
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether the value need to be updated at the time of dragging slider handle.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:

            It is used to customize the Tooltip which accepts custom CSS class names that define
             specific user-defined styles and themes to be applied on the Tooltip element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Format
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            It is used to customize the Tooltip content to the desired format
             using internationalization or events (custom formatting).
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsVisible
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            It is used to show or hide the Tooltip of Slider Component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Placement
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            It is used to denote the position for the tooltip element in the Slider. The available options are:
              Before - Tooltip is shown in the top of the horizontal slider bar or at the left of the vertical slider bar.
              After - Tooltip is shown in the bottom of the horizontal slider bar or at the right of the vertical slider bar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowOn
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            It is used to determine the device mode to show the Tooltip.
            If it is in desktop, it will show the Tooltip content when hovering on the target element.
            If it is in touch device. It will show the Tooltip content when tap and holding on the target element.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The TextBox is an input element that allows to get input from the user. It allows the user to edit or display the text value.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The TextBox is an input element that allows to get input from the user. It allows the user to edit or display the text value.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The TextBox is an input element that allows to get input from the user. It allows the user to edit or display the text value.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The TextBox is an input element that allows to get input from the user. It allows the user to edit or display the text value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Blur
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the TextBox has focus-out.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueChange
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the content of TextBox has changed and gets focus-out.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Created
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the TextBox component is created.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Destroyed
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the TextBox component is destroyed.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Focus
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the TextBox gets focus.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Input
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers each time when the value of TextBox has changed.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Autocomplete
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether the browser is allowed to automatically enter or select a value for the TextBox.
            <para>By default, autocomplete is enabled for TextBox.</para>
            <para>Possible values are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>On</term>
            <description>Specifies that autocomplete is enabled</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Off</term>
            <description>Specifies that autocomplete is disabled.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the floating label behavior of the TextBox that the placeholder text floats above the TextBox based on the following values.
            <para>Possible values are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Never</term>
            <description>Never floats the label in the TextBox when the placeholder is available.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Always</term>
            <description>The floating label always floats above the TextBox.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Auto</term>
            <description>The floating label floats above the TextBox after focusing it or when enters the value in it.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Placeholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the boolean value whether the TextBox allows user to change the text.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Readonly
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the boolean value whether the TextBox allows user to change the text.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowClearButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the clear button is displayed in TextBox.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the width of the TextBox component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: TabIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the tab order of the TextBox component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Multiline
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a boolean value that enables or disables the multiline on the TextBox.
            The TextBox changes from a single line to multiline when enabling this multiline mode.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional html attributes such as styles, class, and more to the root element.
            If you configured both property and equivalent html attributes, then the component considers the property value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: InputAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
            If you configured both property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Type
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the behavior of the TextBox such as text, password, email, and more.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnChange
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the content of input has changed and gets focus-out.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnInput
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers each time when the value of input has changed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnPaste
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the content is paste into an input.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnBlur
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input has focus-out.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnFocus
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input gets focus.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the id of the TextBox component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Value
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the content of the TextBox.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:

            Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the TextBox. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a TextBox.

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable the persisting TextBox state between page reloads. If enabled, the `Value` state will be persisted.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:

            Enable or disable rendering component in the right to left direction.

            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValidateOnInput
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the component validates the input or not. true, If the ValidateOnInput is enabled for form validation, then the model value will be updated on entering the value to the input. otherwise, false.The default value is false. This property is used to validate the form on typing into the input and updating the model value. The ValueChange event will be fired after the component lost its focus.

BoundAttributes.Name: Autocomplete
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether the browser is allowed to automatically enter or select a value for the TextBox.
            <para>By default, autocomplete is enabled for TextBox.</para>
            <para>Possible values are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>On</term>
            <description>Specifies that autocomplete is enabled</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Off</term>
            <description>Specifies that autocomplete is disabled.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the floating label behavior of the TextBox that the placeholder text floats above the TextBox based on the following values.
            <para>Possible values are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Never</term>
            <description>Never floats the label in the TextBox when the placeholder is available.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Always</term>
            <description>The floating label always floats above the TextBox.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Auto</term>
            <description>The floating label floats above the TextBox after focusing it or when enters the value in it.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The uploader component is useful to upload images, documents, and other files to server.
            The component is the extended version of HTML5 that is uploaded with multiple file selection, auto upload, drag and drop, progress bar, preload files, and validation.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            Specifies the list of files that will be preloaded on rendering of uploader component.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            Specifies the list of files that will be preloaded on rendering of uploader component.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The uploader component is useful to upload images, documents, and other files to server.
            The component is the extended version of HTML5 that is uploaded with multiple file selection, auto upload, drag and drop, progress bar, preload files, and validation.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the id of the Uploader component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the content that has to be passed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowedExtensions
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the extensions of the file types allowed in the Uploader component and pass the extensions
            with comma separators.
            <para> For example,if you want to upload specific image files, pass `AllowedExtensions` as ".jpg,.png".</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableHtmlSanitizer
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to prevent the cross site scripting code in filename or not.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the component prevents the cross site scripting code in filename; otherwise,<c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.       
            </value>
            <remarks>
            The Enable HtmlSanitizer property removes the cross-site scripting code or functions from the filename and shows the validation error message to the user.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: AutoUpload
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            By default, the Uploader component initiates automatic upload when the files are added in upload queue.
            <para>If you want to manipulate the files before uploading to server, disable the AutoUpload property.</para>
            <para>The buttons "upload" and "clear" will be hided from file list when AutoUpload property is true.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with root element of the Uploader.
            One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a Uploader.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: DirectoryUpload
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the folder of files can be browsed in the Uploader component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: DropArea
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the drop target to handle the drag-and-drop upload.
            By default, the Uploader creates wrapper around file input that will act as drop target.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: DropEffect
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the drag operation effect to the Uploader component.
            <para> Possible values are .</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Copy</term>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Move</term>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Link</term>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>None</term>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable persisting Uploader state between page reloads. If enabled, the `Files` state will be persisted.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable rendering Uploader in right to left direction.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the Uploader allows the user to interact with it.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>You can add the additional html attributes such as styles, class, and more to the root element.</para>
            <para>If you configured both property and equivalent html attributes, then the component considers the property value.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: InputAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
            If you configured both property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: MaxFileSize
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the maximum allowed file size to be uploaded in bytes.
            The property used to make sure that you cannot upload too large files.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: MinFileSize
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the minimum file size to be uploaded in bytes.
            The property used to make sure that you cannot upload empty files and small files.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowMultiple
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the multiple files can be browsed or dropped simultaneously in the Uploader component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: SequentialUpload
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            By default, the file Uploader component is processing the multiple files simultaneously.
            <para>If SequentialUpload property is enabled, the file upload component performs the upload one after the other.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowFileList
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the default file list can be rendered.
            The property used to prevent default file list and design own template for file list.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: TabIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the tab order of the component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Template
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the HTML string that used to customize the content of each file in the list.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnChange
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the content of input has changed and gets focus-out.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: Context
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the parameter name for all child content expressions.

            Specifies the Uploader Events of the component.
            </summary>

<summary>
            Specifies the content that has to be passed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ChunkSize
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the ChunkSize to split the large file into chunks, and upload it to the server in a sequential order.
            <para>If the ChunkSize property has value, the Uploader enables the chunk upload by default.
            It must be specified in bytes value.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: RemoveUrl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the URL of remove action that receives the file information and handle the remove operation in server.
            <para>The remove action type must be POST request and define "RemoveFileNames" attribute to get file information that will be removed.
            This property is optional.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: RetryAfterDelay
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the delay time in milliseconds that the automatic retry happens after the delay.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: RetryCount
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the number of retries that the Uploader can perform on the file failed to upload.
            By default, the Uploader set 3 as maximum retries. This property must be specified to prevent infinity looping.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: SaveUrl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the URL of save action that will receive the upload files and save in the server.
            <para>The save action type must be POST request and define the argument as same input name used to render the component.
            The upload operations could not perform without this property.</para>
            </summary>

<summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnActionComplete
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers after all the selected files has processed to upload successfully or failed to server.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: BeforeRemove
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers on remove the uploaded file. The event used to get confirm before remove the file from server.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: BeforeUpload
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the upload process before. This event is used to add additional parameter with upload request.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnCancel
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Fires if cancel the chunk file uploading.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueChange
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when changes occur in uploaded file list by selecting or dropping files.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnChunkFailure
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Fires if the chunk file failed to upload.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnChunkSuccess
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Fires when the chunk file uploaded successfully.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnChunkUploadStart
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Fires when every chunk upload process gets started. This event is used to add additional parameter with upload request.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnClear
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers before clearing the items in file list when clicking "clear".
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Created
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the component is created.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnFailure
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the AJAX request fails on uploading or removing files.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnFileListRender
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers before rendering each file item from the file list in a page.
            It helps to customize specific file item structure.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Paused
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Fires if pause the chunk file uploading.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Progressing
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when uploading a file to the server using the AJAX request.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnRemove
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers on removing the uploaded file. The event used to get confirm before removing the file from server.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnResume
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Fires if resume the paused chunk file upload.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FileSelected
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers after selecting or dropping the files by adding the files in upload queue.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Success
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the AJAX request gets success on uploading files or removing files.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnUploadStart
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the upload process gets started. This event is used to add additional parameter with upload request.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Autocomplete
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether the browser is allowed to automatically enter or select a value for the TextBox.
            <para>By default, autocomplete is enabled for TextBox.</para>
            <para>Possible values are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>On</term>
            <description>Specifies that autocomplete is enabled</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Off</term>
            <description>Specifies that autocomplete is disabled.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

            Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the TextBox. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a TextBox.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable the persisting TextBox state between page reloads. If enabled, the `Value` state will be persisted.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable rendering component in the right to left direction.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the TextBox allows the user to interact with it.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the floating label behavior of the TextBox that the placeholder text floats above the TextBox based on the following values.
            <para>Possible values are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Never</term>
            <description>Never floats the label in the TextBox when the placeholder is available.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Always</term>
            <description>The floating label always floats above the TextBox.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Auto</term>
            <description>The floating label floats above the TextBox after focusing it or when enters the value in it.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional html attributes such as styles, class, and more to the root element.
            If you configured both property and equivalent html attributes, then the component considers the property value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
            If you configured both property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The DataManager is a data management component used for performing data operations in applications.
            It acts as an abstraction for using local data source - IEnumerable and remote data source - web services returning JSON or oData.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: HttpClientInstance
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the HttpClient instance to be used  by DataManager.
            </summary>
            <remarks>Use HttpClientInstance property to inject named HttpClient into DataManager.</remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Url
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the endpoint URL. DataManager requests this URL when data is needed.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AdaptorInstance
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the custom adaptor class type. DataManager uses this type value to instantiate custom adaptor class.
            </summary>
            <remarks>DataManager uses Activator.CreateInstance method to create custom adaptor instance.
            Injecting services into custom adaptor class, is not supported while using this approach.
            To inject and use services, provide custom adaptor as a Blazor component by extending DataAdaptor class.</remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Adaptor
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the data adaptor to be used by DataManager.
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>BlazorAdaptor</term>
            <description>Default. BlazorAdaptor is used to process Enumerable data. It contains methods to process the given collection based on the queries.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>ODataAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            OData Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData services.
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>ODataV4Adaptor</term>
            <description>
            ODatav4 Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData v4 services
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>WebApiAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            WebApi Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from WebApi services.
            This adaptor is targeted to interact with Web API created using OData endpoint, it is extended from ODataAdaptor
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>UrlAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            URL Adaptor is used when you are required to interact with all kind of remote services to retrieve data.
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>RemoteSaveAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            Remote Save Adaptor is used for binding JSON data.
            It interacts with remote services only for CRUD operations.
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>CustomAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            CustomAdaptor specifies that own data query and manipulation logic has been provided using custom adaptor component
            extended from DataAdaptor class.
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>JsonAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            JsonAdaptor is used to process JSON data at the client side. It contains methods to process the given JSON data based on the queries.
            </description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: DataAdaptor
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Holds adaptor instance.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: InsertUrl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the insert URL.
            </summary>
            <remarks>Applicable for remote adaptors.
            When Insert method is called, request will be made to InsertUrl.
            If InsertUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.</remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: RemoveUrl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the remove URL.
            </summary>
            <remarks>Applicable for remote adaptors.
            When Remove method is called, request will be made to RemoveUrl.
            If RemoveUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.</remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: UpdateUrl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the update URL.
            </summary>
            <remarks>Applicable for remote adaptors.
            When Update method is called, request will be made to UpdateUrl.
            If UpdateUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.</remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: CrudUrl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the CRUD URL.
            </summary>
            <remarks>Applicable for remote adaptors.
            When Insert, Remove or Update method is called, request will be made to CrudUrl.
            If CrudUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.</remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: BatchUrl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the batch url.
            </summary>
            <remarks>Applicable for remote adaptors.
            When SaveChanges method is called, request will be made to BatchUrl.
            If BatchUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.</remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Json
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the IEnumerable collection. This data could be queried and manipulated.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Headers
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the key/value pair of headers.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Use Headers to add any custom headers to the request made by DataManager.
            Users can also send authentication bearer token using Headers property.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Accept
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the accept type.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Data
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the IEnumerale data.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: TimeTillExpiration
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the time limit to clear the cached data.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CachingPageSize
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the caching page size.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableCaching
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enables data caching.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: RequestType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the request type for sending data fetching.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: Key
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the primary key value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CrossDomain
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            When true, then indicates that the request is a cross-domain request.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Jsonp
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the jsonp request.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: DataType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the data type.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Offline
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enables offline mode in datamanager.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Applicable for remote data source. If offline is true then initial request will be made to fetch
            data. Further actions will be handled at the in-memory data and no more request will be made to the service.
            Cached data is stored in the JSON property.
            </remarks>

            Sepcifies requires format.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Defines the child content.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AdaptorInstance
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the custom adaptor class type. DataManager uses this type value to instantiate custom adaptor class.
            </summary>
            <remarks>DataManager uses Activator.CreateInstance method to create custom adaptor instance.
            Injecting services into custom adaptor class, is not supported while using this approach.
            To inject and use services, provide custom adaptor as a Blazor component by extending DataAdaptor class.</remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Adaptor
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the data adaptor to be used by DataManager.
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>BlazorAdaptor</term>
            <description>Default. BlazorAdaptor is used to process Enumerable data. It contains methods to process the given collection based on the queries.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>ODataAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            OData Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData services.
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>ODataV4Adaptor</term>
            <description>
            ODatav4 Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData v4 services
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>WebApiAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            WebApi Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from WebApi services.
            This adaptor is targeted to interact with Web API created using OData endpoint, it is extended from ODataAdaptor
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>UrlAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            URL Adaptor is used when you are required to interact with all kind of remote services to retrieve data.
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>RemoteSaveAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            Remote Save Adaptor is used for binding JSON data.
            It interacts with remote services only for CRUD operations.
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>CustomAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            CustomAdaptor specifies that own data query and manipulation logic has been provided using custom adaptor component
            extended from DataAdaptor class.
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>JsonAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            JsonAdaptor is used to process JSON data at the client side. It contains methods to process the given JSON data based on the queries.
            </description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery
TagHelpers.Documentation: The Blazor Media Query component allows developers to create responsive layouts. The component tracks changes in the browser size and notifies when the browser size matches the specified media query. The class is used to store information about each media query breakpoint, including the Breakpoint name and the MediaQuery itself. The property returns the Breakpoint of the MediaBreakpoint in the MediaBreakpoints collection that matches the current browser size. This allows developers to easily create responsive layouts that adapt to different screen sizes and device types. Loading... } else { @if(activeBreakpoint == "Small") { } else { } } @code { private string activeBreakpoint; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ActiveBreakpoint
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets the of the in collection that matches with the current browser size. Based on the ActiveBreakpoint, developers can easily create responsive layouts that adapt to different screen sizes and device types. A string value that represents the of the in collection that matches with the browser size. The default value is null.

BoundAttributes.Name: MediaBreakpoints
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the collection of <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint" /> that contains the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.Breakpoint" /> and <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.MediaQuery" />.
            <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.ActiveBreakpoint" /> is set when a <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.MediaQuery" /> matches with the current browser size from this collection.
            </summary>
            <value>
            A collection of <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint" /> that contains the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.Breakpoint" /> and <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.MediaQuery" />.
            The defaul value is empty collection.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            If <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.MediaBreakpoints" /> is not specified, <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery" /> will use built-in collection of <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint" /> that contains <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.Small" />, <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.Medium" /> and <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.Large" /> media queries.
            </remarks>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfAutoComplete<TValue, TItem>
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The AutoComplete component provides the matched suggestion list when type into the input, from which the user can select one.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The AutoComplete component provides the matched suggestion list when type into the input, from which the user can select one.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: TValue
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TValue for the Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfAutoComplete<TValue, TItem> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: TItem
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TItem for the Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfAutoComplete<TValue, TItem> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: Highlight
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            When set to 'true', highlight the searched characters on suggested list items.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: MinLength
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Allows you to set the minimum search character length, the search action will perform after typed minimum characters.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Determines on which filter type, the component needs to be considered on search action.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowClearButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Specifies whether to show or hide the clear button.</para>
            <para>When the clear button is clicked, `Value` properties are reset to null.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowPopupButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Allows you to either show or hide the popup button on the component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: SuggestionCount
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Supports the specified number of list items on the suggestion popup.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowCustom
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether the component allows user defined value which does not exist in data source.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Autofill
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether suggest a first matched item in input when searching. No action happens when no matches found.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValidateOnInput
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the component validates the input or not. true, If the ValidateOnInput is enabled for form validation, then the model value will be updated on entering the value to the input. otherwise, false.The default value is false. This property is used to validate the form on typing into the input and updating the model value. The ValueChange event will be fired after the component lost its focus.

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the unique identifier for <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListEvents`2" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            You can specify only unique value.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the content that has to be passed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueExpression
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an expression that identifies the bound value in the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListEvents`2" /> component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowFiltering
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the filtering option is enabled or not. true, if the filtering option is enabled and show the filter bar (search box) in the pop-up; otherwise, false.The default value is false. The filter action retrieves the matched items using the event based on the characters typed in the search textbox.

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a CSS class string to customize the appearance of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListEvents`2" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether the right-to-left direction is enabled or not for the drop-down list component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction is enabled for dropdown list component. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
             Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListEvents`2" /> component. 
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the Dropdown list component is enabled; otherwise, it is disabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to persist component's state between page reloads. When set to <c>true</c>, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Value" /> property is persisted.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the component's state persistence is enabled. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            Component's <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Value" /> property will be stored in browser local storage to persist component's state when page reloads.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterBarPlaceholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text that is displayed when the filter textbox has no text and removes the focus.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The text that is displayed when the filter text box has no text. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property value is updated only when the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.AllowFiltering" /> is enabled.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the floating label behavior of the dropdown list. The text act as a lable. One of the enumeration. The default value is If the FloatLabelType is Never, the placeholder text does not float as a label. If the FloatLabelType is Auto, the placeholder text will float above the DropDownList component as a label after focusing it. If the FloatLabelType is Always, the placeholder text is displayed as a label above the DropDownList component. In the following code example, set the float lable as Auto. @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: FooterTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the customised design content and assigns it to the footer container of the pop-up list. The template content. The default value in null. Total list items: 3 @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: HeaderTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the customised design content and assigns it to the header container of the popup list. The template content. The default value in null. T-shirt size @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes such as styles, class, and more that will be applied to the dropdown list element. The value as dictionary collection.The default value is null Additional attributes can be added by specifying as inline attributes or by specifying @attributes directive. @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; Dictionary CustomAttribute = new Dictionary() { { "title", "Select T-shirt size" } } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: InputAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes such as disabled, value, and more that will be applied to the dropdown list input element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The value as dictionary collection. The default value is <c>null</c>
            </value>
            <remarks>
            If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Index
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the index of the selected item in the dropdown list component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The index of the selected items in the list. The default value is <c>null</c> which indicates that nothing is selected.
            </value>
            <exception cref="T:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException">The index was set to less than -1, or greater than or equal to the number of items on the list at the time the list is rendered.</exception>
            <remarks>
            Use this property to determine the index of the currently selected item in the list if the dropdown list component allows only one selection.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: IndexChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the callback to trigger when the index changes.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Placeholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text that is displayed when the dropdown list has no value and remove on the focus.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The text that is displayed when the dropdown list has no value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            The property depends on the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.FloatLabelType" /> property, The placeholder text acts as a label.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupHeight
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the height of the popup list.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The preferred height of the popup list in pixels or percentage of the dropdown list. The default value is <c>300px</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property accepts pixels or percentage value.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupWidth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the width of the popup list. By default, the popup width sets based on the width of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The preferred width of the popup list in pixels or percentage of the dropdown list. The default value is <c>100%</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property accepts pixels or percentage value.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Readonly
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2" /> is in read-only mode or not.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if the dropdown list is in read-only mode; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            In read-only mode, the dropdown list popup can not be opened on click.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableVirtualization
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the virtual scrolling is enabled or not.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if the virtual scrolling for dropdown list; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            To improve performance, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.EnableVirtualization" /> property is set to <c>true</c>. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ItemsCount
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the number of items to be fetched in the popup when the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.EnableVirtualization" /> property is enabled.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The number of list items to be fetched in dropdown list component. The default value is <c>5</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Value
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets the value of the selected item in the dropdown list component. This will be used with two-way binding.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The value of the selected item in the dropdown list component. The default is <c>null</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            Use the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Value" /> property to specify or determine the value displayed in the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2" /> component.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a callback that trigger when the value changes.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the customised design content and assigns it to the selected list item in the input element of the component. The template content. The default value in null. T-shirt size - @(context) @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the width of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The preferred width of the dropdown list in pixels or percentage value. The default value is <c>100%</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: TabIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the location of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2" /> component in the tab order.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The numeric index of the dropdown list in the tab order. The default value is <c>0</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnChange
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the content of input has changed and gets focus-out.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnInput
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers each time when the value of input has changed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnBlur
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input loses the focus.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnFocus
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input gets focus.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ItemTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the template design and assigns it to each list item present in the popup.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: GroupTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the template design and assigns it to the group headers present in the popup list.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: NoRecordsTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the template design and assigns it to popup list of component, when no data is available on the component.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ActionFailureTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the template and assigns it to the popup list content of the component, when the data fetch request from the remote server fails.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: SortOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Specifies the `SortOrder` to sort the data source.</para>
            <para>The available type of sort orders are.</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>None</term>
            <description>The data source is not sorting.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Ascending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with ascending order.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Descending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with descending order.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The order of sorting the list items. The default value is <c>SortOrder.None</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: DataSource
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Gets or sets the list items either through local or remote service and binds it to the component.</para>
            <para>It can be an array of JSON Objects or an instance of `DataManager`.</para>
            </summary>
            <value> 
            Binding data to the popup element. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Query
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the external `Query` that execute along with data processing.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            Query value to be used for data fetching. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IgnoreCase
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether case-sensitivity is enabled or disabled when searching for suggestions.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>false</c>, consider the `case-sensitive` on performing the search to find suggestions. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IgnoreAccent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether diacritic characters or accents are ignored.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, ignores the diacritic characters or accents when filtering. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ZIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the z-index value of the component popup element.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The ZIndex value for the popup element.The default value is <c>1000</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Context
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the parameter name for all child content expressions.

            This property value is updated only when the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.AllowFiltering" /> is enabled.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the floating label behavior of the dropdown list. The text act as a lable. One of the enumeration. The default value is If the FloatLabelType is Never, the placeholder text does not float as a label. If the FloatLabelType is Auto, the placeholder text will float above the DropDownList component as a label after focusing it. If the FloatLabelType is Always, the placeholder text is displayed as a label above the DropDownList component. In the following code example, set the float lable as Auto. @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: FooterTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the customised design content and assigns it to the footer container of the pop-up list. The template content. The default value in null. Total list items: 3 @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: HeaderTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the customised design content and assigns it to the header container of the popup list. The template content. The default value in null. T-shirt size @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes such as styles, class, and more that will be applied to the dropdown list element. The value as dictionary collection.The default value is null Additional attributes can be added by specifying as inline attributes or by specifying @attributes directive. @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; Dictionary CustomAttribute = new Dictionary() { { "title", "Select T-shirt size" } } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: InputAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes such as disabled, value, and more that will be applied to the dropdown list input element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The value as dictionary collection. The default value is <c>null</c>
            </value>
            <remarks>
            If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Index
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the index of the selected item in the dropdown list component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The index of the selected items in the list. The default value is <c>null</c> which indicates that nothing is selected.
            </value>
            <exception cref="T:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException">The index was set to less than -1, or greater than or equal to the number of items on the list at the time the list is rendered.</exception>
            <remarks>
            Use this property to determine the index of the currently selected item in the list if the dropdown list component allows only one selection.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: IndexChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the callback to trigger when the index changes.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Placeholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text that is displayed when the dropdown list has no value and remove on the focus.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The text that is displayed when the dropdown list has no value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            The property depends on the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.FloatLabelType" /> property, The placeholder text acts as a label.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupHeight
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the height of the popup list.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The preferred height of the popup list in pixels or percentage of the dropdown list. The default value is <c>300px</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property accepts pixels or percentage value.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupWidth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the width of the popup list. By default, the popup width sets based on the width of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The preferred width of the popup list in pixels or percentage of the dropdown list. The default value is <c>100%</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property accepts pixels or percentage value.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Readonly
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2" /> is in read-only mode or not.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if the dropdown list is in read-only mode; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            In read-only mode, the dropdown list popup can not be opened on click.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableVirtualization
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value indicating whether the virtual scrolling is enabled or not.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c> if the virtual scrolling for dropdown list; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            To improve performance, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.EnableVirtualization" /> property is set to <c>true</c>. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ItemsCount
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the number of items to be fetched in the popup when the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.EnableVirtualization" /> property is enabled.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The number of list items to be fetched in dropdown list component. The default value is <c>5</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Value
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets the value of the selected item in the dropdown list component. This will be used with two-way binding.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The value of the selected item in the dropdown list component. The default is <c>null</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            Use the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Value" /> property to specify or determine the value displayed in the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2" /> component.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a callback that trigger when the value changes.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the customised design content and assigns it to the selected list item in the input element of the component. The template content. The default value in null. T-shirt size - @(context) @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the width of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The preferred width of the dropdown list in pixels or percentage value. The default value is <c>100%</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: TabIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the location of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2" /> component in the tab order.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The numeric index of the dropdown list in the tab order. The default value is <c>0</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnChange
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the content of input has changed and gets focus-out.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnInput
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers each time when the value of input has changed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnBlur
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input loses the focus.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnFocus
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input gets focus.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ItemTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the template design and assigns it to each list item present in the popup.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: GroupTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the template design and assigns it to the group headers present in the popup list.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: NoRecordsTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the template design and assigns it to popup list of component, when no data is available on the component.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ActionFailureTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the template and assigns it to the popup list content of the component, when the data fetch request from the remote server fails.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: SortOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Specifies the `SortOrder` to sort the data source.</para>
            <para>The available type of sort orders are.</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>None</term>
            <description>The data source is not sorting.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Ascending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with ascending order.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Descending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with descending order.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The order of sorting the list items. The default value is <c>SortOrder.None</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: DataSource
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Gets or sets the list items either through local or remote service and binds it to the component.</para>
            <para>It can be an array of JSON Objects or an instance of `DataManager`.</para>
            </summary>
            <value> 
            Binding data to the popup element. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Query
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the external `Query` that execute along with data processing.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            Query value to be used for data fetching. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IgnoreCase
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether case-sensitivity is enabled or disabled when searching for suggestions.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>false</c>, consider the `case-sensitive` on performing the search to find suggestions. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IgnoreAccent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether diacritic characters or accents are ignored.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, ignores the diacritic characters or accents when filtering. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ZIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the z-index value of the component popup element.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The ZIndex value for the popup element.The default value is <c>1000</c>.
            </value>
