TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfComboBox<TValue, TItem>
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The ComboBox component allows the user to type a value or choose an option from the list of predefined options.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The ComboBox component allows the user to type a value or choose an option from the list of predefined options.
            </summary>
            <typeparam name="TValue">Specifies the value type.</typeparam>
            <typeparam name="TItem">Specifies the type of SfComboBox.</typeparam>

BoundAttributes.Name: TValue
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TValue for the Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfComboBox<TValue, TItem> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: TItem
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TItem for the Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfComboBox<TValue, TItem> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowCustom
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether the component allows user defined value which does not exist in data source.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Autofill
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether suggest a first matched item in input when searching. No action happens when no matches found.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowClearButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Specifies whether to show or hide the clear button.</para>
            <para>When the clear button is clicked, `Value`, `Text`, and `Index` properties are reset to null.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValidateOnInput
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the component validates the input or not. true, If the ValidateOnInput is enabled for form validation, then the model value will be updated on entering the value to the input. otherwise, false.The default value is false. This property is used to validate the form on typing into the input and updating the model value. The ValueChange event will be fired after the component lost its focus.

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the unique identifier for <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListEvents`2" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            You can specify only unique value.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the content that has to be passed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueExpression
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an expression that identifies the bound value in the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListEvents`2" /> component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowFiltering
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the filtering option is enabled or not. true, if the filtering option is enabled and show the filter bar (search box) in the pop-up; otherwise, false.The default value is false. The filter action retrieves the matched items using the event based on the characters typed in the search textbox.

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a CSS class string to customize the appearance of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListEvents`2" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether the right-to-left direction is enabled or not for the drop-down list component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction is enabled for dropdown list component. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
             Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListEvents`2" /> component. 
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the Dropdown list component is enabled; otherwise, it is disabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to persist component's state between page reloads. When set to <c>true</c>, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Value" /> property is persisted.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the component's state persistence is enabled. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            Component's <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Value" /> property will be stored in browser local storage to persist component's state when page reloads.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterBarPlaceholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text that is displayed when the filter textbox has no text and removes the focus.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The text that is displayed when the filter text box has no text. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property value is updated only when the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.AllowFiltering" /> is enabled.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the floating label behavior of the dropdown list. The text act as a lable. One of the enumeration. The default value is If the FloatLabelType is Never, the placeholder text does not float as a label. If the FloatLabelType is Auto, the placeholder text will float above the DropDownList component as a label after focusing it. If the FloatLabelType is Always, the placeholder text is displayed as a label above the DropDownList component. In the following code example, set the float lable as Auto. @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: FooterTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the customised design content and assigns it to the footer container of the pop-up list. The template content. The default value in null. Total list items: 3 @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: HeaderTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the customised design content and assigns it to the header container of the popup list. The template content. The default value in null. T-shirt size @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes such as styles, class, and more that will be applied to the dropdown list element. The value as dictionary collection.The default value is null Additional attributes can be added by specifying as inline attributes or by specifying @attributes directive. @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; Dictionary CustomAttribute = new Dictionary() { { "title", "Select T-shirt size" } } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: InputAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes such as disabled, value, and more that will be applied to the dropdown list input element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The value as dictionary collection. The default value is <c>null</c>
            </value>
            <remarks>
            If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Index
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the index of the selected item in the dropdown list component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The index of the selected items in the list. The default value is <c>null</c> which indicates that nothing is selected.
            </value>
            <exception cref="T:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException">The index was set to less than -1, or greater than or equal to the number of items on the list at the time the list is rendered.</exception>
            <remarks>
            Use this property to determine the index of the currently selected item in the list if the dropdown list component allows only one selection.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: IndexChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the callback to trigger when the index changes.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Placeholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text that is displayed when the dropdown list has no value and remove on the focus.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The text that is displayed when the dropdown list has no value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            The property depends on the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.FloatLabelType" /> property, The placeholder text acts as a label.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupHeight
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the height of the popup list.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The preferred height of the popup list in pixels or percentage of the dropdown list. The default value is <c>300px</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property accepts pixels or percentage value.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupWidth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the width of the popup list. By default, the popup width sets based on the width of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The preferred width of the popup list in pixels or percentage of the dropdown list. The default value is <c>100%</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValidateOnInput
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the component validates the input or not. true, If the ValidateOnInput is enabled for form validation, then the model value will be updated on entering the value to the input. otherwise, false.The default value is false. This property is used to validate the form on typing into the input and updating the model value. The ValueChange event will be fired after the component lost its focus.

            </value>

BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the filtering option is enabled or not. true, if the filtering option is enabled and show the filter bar (search box) in the pop-up; otherwise, false.The default value is false. The filter action retrieves the matched items using the event based on the characters typed in the search textbox.

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to persist component's state between page reloads. When set to <c>true</c>, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Value" /> property is persisted.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the component's state persistence is enabled. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            Component's <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Value" /> property will be stored in browser local storage to persist component's state when page reloads.
            </remarks>

            </value>
            <remarks>
            This property value is updated only when the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.AllowFiltering" /> is enabled.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the floating label behavior of the dropdown list. The text act as a lable. One of the enumeration. The default value is If the FloatLabelType is Never, the placeholder text does not float as a label. If the FloatLabelType is Auto, the placeholder text will float above the DropDownList component as a label after focusing it. If the FloatLabelType is Always, the placeholder text is displayed as a label above the DropDownList component. In the following code example, set the float lable as Auto. @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

            </value>
            <exception cref="T:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException">The index was set to less than -1, or greater than or equal to the number of items on the list at the time the list is rendered.</exception>
            <remarks>
            Use this property to determine the index of the currently selected item in the list if the dropdown list component allows only one selection.

BoundAttributes.Name: OnActionBegin
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked before fetching data from the data source.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnActionComplete
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the evnet callback that will be invoked after data is fetched successfully from the data source.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnActionFailure
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when the data fetch request fails.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnOpen
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when the dropdown popup before opens. You can prevent the dropdown popup open action using . @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; public void OnOpenHandler(BeforeOpenEventArgs args) { args.Cancel = true; } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Blur
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when the dropdown list loses focus.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueChange
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked when the property changed. This event triggers when an item in a popup is selected or when the model value is changed by user. @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; public void OnChange(Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.ChangeEventArgs args) { var DDLValue = args.Value; } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnClose
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked before the dropdown popup is close. You can prevent the dropdown popup close action using and the popup remains opened always. @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; public void OnCloseHandler(PopupEventArgs args) { args.Cancel = true; } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Filtering
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked on typing a character in the filter textbox. You can prevent the default filter action and make your query enable the event argument, and pass the modify data source and query in method. @code{ SfDropDownList DDLObj { get; set; } protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; public async Task OnFilteringHandler(FilteringEventArgs args) { args.PreventDefaultAction = true; var query = new Query().Where(new WhereFilter() { Field = "Text", Operator = "contains", value = args.Text, IgnoreCase = true }); await DDLObj.FilterAsync(MyList, query); } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Closed

BoundAttributes.Name: OnValueSelect
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the event callback that will be when an item is selected from the dropdown popup by the user either with mouse/tap or with keyboard navigation. You can prevent the item selection action using . @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; public void OnSelectHandler(SelectEventArgs args) { if(args.ItemData== "Medium") args.Cancel = true; } } ]]>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListFieldSettings
TagHelpers.Documentation: A class that represents the Dropdown list fields to map with the data source and binds the data to the component. @code{ public class Country { public string Name { get; set; } public string Code { get; set; } } List Countries = new List { new Country() { Name = "Australia", Code = "AU" }, new Country() { Name = "Bermuda", Code = "BM" }, new Country() { Name = "Canada", Code = "CA" } }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: GroupBy
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets filed names to display the list in category-wise. Accepts a string value. The default value is String.Empty. @code{ public class Vegetables { public string ID { get; set; } public string Name { get; set; } public string Category { get; set; } } List VegetablesList = new List { new Vegetables { Name = "Cabbage", Category = "Leafy and Salad", ID = "item1" }, new Vegetables { Name = "Chickpea", Category = "Beans", ID = "item2" }, new Vegetables { Name = "Green bean", Category = "Beans", ID = "item4" }, new Vegetables { Name = "Spinach", Category = "Leafy and Salad", ID = "item9" } }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes such as styles, classes, and more that will be applied to the pop-up list element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The value as dictionary collection.The default value is <c>null</c>
            </value>
            <remarks>
            If you configured both property and equivalent html attributes, then the component considers the property value.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconCss
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a CSS class string to include an icon or image for the dropdown list item. 
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to include an icon or image for the dropdown list item. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Text
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text that maps the text field from the data source model for each list item.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            If not mapped, the text field in the drop-down list item show as an empty text for each list item.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Value
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the value that maps the value field from the data source for each list item.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            If not mapped the text filed in the dropdown list item show as empty popup.
            </remarks>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList<TValue, TItem>
TagHelpers.Documentation: The DropDownList component allows users to select a single value that is non-editable from a list of predefined values. In the following code example, a basic DropDownList component is initialized with simple list items. @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]> The DropDownList component contains a list of predefined values from which a single value can be chosen. The DropDownList component contains a list of predefined values from which a single value can be chosen. Specifies the value type. Specifies the type of SfDropDownList.

The default value is If the FloatLabelType is Never, the placeholder text does not float as a label. If the FloatLabelType is Auto, the placeholder text will float above the DropDownList component as a label after focusing it. If the FloatLabelType is Always, the placeholder text is displayed as a label above the DropDownList component. In the following code example, set the float lable as Auto. @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

            Gets or sets the width of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The preferred width of the dropdown list in pixels or percentage value. The default value is <c>100%</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: TabIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the location of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2" /> component in the tab order.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The numeric index of the dropdown list in the tab order. The default value is <c>0</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnChange
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the content of input has changed and gets focus-out.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnInput
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers each time when the value of input has changed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnBlur
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input loses the focus.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnFocus
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input gets focus.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ItemTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the template design and assigns it to each list item present in the popup.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: GroupTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the template design and assigns it to the group headers present in the popup list.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: NoRecordsTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the template design and assigns it to popup list of component, when no data is available on the component.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ActionFailureTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the template and assigns it to the popup list content of the component, when the data fetch request from the remote server fails.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: SortOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Specifies the `SortOrder` to sort the data source.</para>
            <para>The available type of sort orders are.</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>None</term>
            <description>The data source is not sorting.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Ascending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with ascending order.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Descending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with descending order.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The order of sorting the list items. The default value is <c>SortOrder.None</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: DataSource
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Gets or sets the list items either through local or remote service and binds it to the component.</para>
            <para>It can be an array of JSON Objects or an instance of `DataManager`.</para>
            </summary>
            <value> 
            Binding data to the popup element. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Query
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the external `Query` that execute along with data processing.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            Query value to be used for data fetching. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets which filter type, the component needs to be considered on search action.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The filter type specifed for searching the list items. The default value is <c>FilterType.StartsWith</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IgnoreCase
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether case-sensitivity is enabled or disabled when searching for suggestions.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>false</c>, consider the `case-sensitive` on performing the search to find suggestions. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IgnoreAccent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether diacritic characters or accents are ignored.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, ignores the diacritic characters or accents when filtering. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ZIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the z-index value of the component popup element.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The ZIndex value for the popup element.The default value is <c>1000</c>.
            </value>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox<TValue, TItem>
TagHelpers.Documentation: ListBox component used to display a list of items. Users can select one or more items in the list using a checkbox or by keyboard selection. It supports sorting, grouping, reordering and drag and drop of items. ListBox component used to display a list of items. Users can select one or more items in the list using a checkbox or by keyboard selection. It supports sorting, grouping, reordering and drag and drop of items. ListBox is used to display a list of items. Users can select one or more items in the list using a checkbox or by keyboard selection. It supports sorting, grouping, reordering and drag and drop of items. In the below code example, showcases a basic listbox. @code{ privatestring[] value= newstring[] { "List-01"}; privateListvehicleData = newList{ newListItem { Text = "Hennessey Venom", Id = "List-01"}, newListItem { Text = "Bugatti Chiron", Id = "List-02"}, newListItem { Text = "Bugatti Veyron Super Sport", Id = "List-03"} } } ]]> ListBox is used to display a list of items. Users can select one or more items in the list using a checkbox or by keyboard selection. It supports sorting, grouping, reordering and drag and drop of items. ListBox component is used to display a list of items. Users can select one or more items in the list using a checkbox or by keyboard selection. It supports sorting, grouping, reordering and drag and drop of items. In the below code example, showcases a basic ListBox component. @code{ privatestring[] value= newstring[] { "List-01"}; privateListvehicleData = newList{ newListItem { Text = "Hennessey Venom", Id = "List-01"}, newListItem { Text = "Bugatti Chiron", Id = "List-02"}, newListItem { Text = "Bugatti Veyron Super Sport", Id = "List-03"} } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the child content for the listbox including HTML element. If the child content is not specified, listbox is rendered using <c>DataSource</c> property.

            <value>
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>.
            </value>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueExpression
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the expression for defining the value of the bound.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowDragAndDrop
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the drag and drop support in the listbox.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the drag and drop is performed in the listbox. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            ListBox contains same 'Scope' property to perform drag and drop between multiple list boxes.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowFiltering
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or diaable the filtering in the listbox.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the filtering is performed in the listbox. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that indicates CSS class string to customize the appearance of listbox.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance of listbox. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the right to left direction in listbox.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction is enabled for listbox. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the component allows the user to interact with it.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence

BoundAttributes.Name: MaximumSelectionLength

            Gets or sets a value that indicates the limitation to the value selection in the listbox.

            <value>
            Accepts a double value. The default value is <c>500</c>.

            Based on the limitation, list selection will be prevented.

BoundAttributes.Name: SortOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Specifies the `SortOrder` to sort the data source.</para>
            <para>The available type of sort orders are.</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>None</term>
            <description>The data source is not sorting.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Ascending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with ascending order.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Descending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with descending order.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The order of sorting the list items. The default value is <c>SortOrder.None</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: DataSource
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Gets or sets the list items either through local or remote service and binds it to the component.</para>
            <para>It can be an array of JSON Objects or an instance of `DataManager`.</para>
            </summary>
            <value> 
            Binding data to the popup element. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Query
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the external `Query` that execute along with data processing.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            Query value to be used for data fetching. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets which filter type, the component needs to be considered on search action.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The filter type specifed for searching the list items. The default value is <c>FilterType.StartsWith</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IgnoreCase
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether case-sensitivity is enabled or disabled when searching for suggestions.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>false</c>, consider the `case-sensitive` on performing the search to find suggestions. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IgnoreAccent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether diacritic characters or accents are ignored.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, ignores the diacritic characters or accents when filtering. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ZIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the z-index value of the component popup element.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The ZIndex value for the popup element.The default value is <c>1000</c>.
            </value>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.ListBoxSelectionSettings
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            Defines the selection settings of List Box.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CheckboxPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the position of a checkbox.
            </summary>
            <value>
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.CheckBoxPosition" /> enumeration. The default value is <c>Left</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            If the <c>CheckBoxPosition</c> is <c>Left</c>, the checkbox will be placed left to the content of the list item.
            If the <c>CheckBoxPosition</c> is <c>Right</c>, the checkbox will be placed right to the content of the list item.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Mode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the mode of selection in the listbox.
            </summary>
            <value>
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SelectionMode" /> enumeration. The default value is <c>Multile</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            If the <c>SelectionMode</c> is <c>Single</c>, allows single selection.
            If the <c>SelectionMode</c> is <c>Multiple</c>, alloes multiple selection.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowCheckbox
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the checkox selection in listbox.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the checkox selection is enabled for listbox. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowSelectAll
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the select all checkox option in listbox.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the select all checkox option is enabled for listbox. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.MentionFieldSettings
TagHelpers.Documentation:
The MentionFieldSettings class is a configuration class that is used to specify which fields in a data source should be used for different aspects of a mention list, For example, you can use this class to specify which fields in a data source should be used for the text and value of each item in the mention list, as well as an optional field for grouping items. This allows the mention list to be populated with data from the specified data source, making it easier for users to select items from the list. This can be useful in scenarios where users need to select items from a large or complex data set, such as selecting names from a list of contacts or selecting products from a catalog. In this example, the MentionFieldSettings class is used to specify that the Text and ID fields in the data source should be used for the text and value of each item in the mention list, respectively.
@code{ public class Games { public string ID { get; set; } public string Text { get; set; } } List GamesData = new List { new Games() { ID= "Game1", Text= "American Football" }, new Games() { ID= "Game2", Text= "Badminton" }, new Games() { ID= "Game3", Text= "Basketball" }, new Games() { ID= "Game4", Text= "Cricket" }, new Games() { ID= "Game5", Text= "Football" }, new Games() { ID= "Game6", Text= "Golf" } }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: GroupBy
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a field in the data source that should be used for grouping items in the mention list.
            </summary>
            <value>
            A field in the data source that should be used for grouping items in the mention list.
            The default value is <c>string.Empty</c>. 
            This is optional and does not have to be specified if you do not want to group items in the mention list. 
            If you do not specify a <c>GroupBy</c>, all items in the mention list will be displayed in a single, ungrouped list.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconCss
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the CSS class which is used to specify the field in the data source that contains the CSS class name for the icon that should be displayed for each item in the mention list.
            </summary>
            <value>
            A field in data source that contains the CSS class name for the icon that should be displayed for each item in the mention list.
            </value>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.MentionFieldSettings
TagHelpers.Documentation:
The MentionFieldSettings class is a configuration class that is used to specify which fields in a data source should be used for different aspects of a mention list, For example, you can use this class to specify which fields in a data source should be used for the text and value of each item in the mention list, as well as an optional field for grouping items. This allows the mention list to be populated with data from the specified data source, making it easier for users to select items from the list. This can be useful in scenarios where users need to select items from a large or complex data set, such as selecting names from a list of contacts or selecting products from a catalog. In this example, the MentionFieldSettings class is used to specify that the Text and ID fields in the data source should be used for the text and value of each item in the mention list, respectively.
@code{ public class Games { public string ID { get; set; } public string Text { get; set; } } List GamesData = new List { new Games() { ID= "Game1", Text= "American Football" }, new Games() { ID= "Game2", Text= "Badminton" }, new Games() { ID= "Game3", Text= "Basketball" }, new Games() { ID= "Game4", Text= "Cricket" }, new Games() { ID= "Game5", Text= "Football" }, new Games() { ID= "Game6", Text= "Golf" } }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: GroupBy
BoundAttributes.Documentation:

            Gets or sets a field in the data source that should be used for grouping items in the mention list.
            </summary>
            <value>
            A field in the data source that should be used for grouping items in the mention list.
            The default value is <c>string.Empty</c>. 
            This is optional and does not have to be specified if you do not want to group items in the mention list. 
            If you do not specify a <c>GroupBy</c>, all items in the mention list will be displayed in a single, ungrouped list.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Target
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the target selector for displaying the component. The SfMention component listens to user input on the target element displays suggestions as soon as the user enters the mention character. This allows users to easily select items from the list of suggestions by typing the mention character and then selecting an item from the list. An element on the page should be used as the target for the SfMention component, so that mention component displays suggestion list opens relative to the elements cursor position. The Target property is required and must be specified.
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: MentionChar
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the symbol or single character which triggers the search action in the component. The SfMention component listens to user input on the element displays suggestions as soon as the user enters the mention character. A character of symbol. By default, the trigger character is the @ symbol..
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowMentionChar
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to show the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMention`1.MentionChar" /> along with with the text when displaying selected mention item in target.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, the selected mention item displayed along with the mention character. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            If <c>ShowMentionChar</c> is set to <c>true</c>, the <c>mention</c> component will display the mention character along with the text of the mentioned item. 
            For example, if the mention character is <c>@</c> and the user mentions the item "John Doe", the mention will be displayed as @John Doe.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the filter type that specifies the match criteria while searching for mentions. The possible values for the property are: StartsWith lists the items if the start of the text in the item matches with the search term or input string. EndsWith lists the items if the end of the text in the item matches with the search term or input string. Contains lists the items if the item text contains the search term or input string. One of the enumeration that specifies the match criteria while searching. The default value is .
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowSpaces
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to continue search action if user enter space after mention character while searching.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, the search action takes place even after a space, if the DataSource data's are matched. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            By default, the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMention`1" /> component will only search for mentions when the mention character is immediately followed by a non-whitespace character (e.g. @john but not @ john). 
            However, you can change this behavior and allow the SfMention component to continue searching for mentions even if the user enters a space after the mention character by setting the <c>AllowSpaces</c> property to true.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: SuffixText
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the custom suffix that will be appended to the end of the mentioned item's text when it is inserted into the target editor. Accepts as string value. The default value is String.Empty. When a item is selected, the component will automatically insert the text of the mentioned item into the target editor. By default, the mention component will insert the text of the mentioned item without any additional text or characters. However, you can specify a custom suffix that will be appended to the end of the mentioned item's text when it is inserted into the target editor.
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: SuggestionCount
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the maximum number of items that will be displayed in the suggestion list. The maximum number of items that will be displayed in the suggestion list. The default value is 25. By default, the component will display all of the items in the suggestions list. However, you can limit the number of items that are displayed in the list by setting the property.
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: MinLength
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the minimum length of user input that is required to initiate the search action. The minimum number of characters user input that is required to initiate the search action.The default value is 0. By default, the component will initiate a search as soon as the user begins typing in the editable element. You can change this behavior by setting the property. For example, if you wanted to require the user to enter at least 3 characters before a search is initiated, you could use the following code:
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: SortOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Specifies the `SortOrder` to sort the data source.</para>
            <para>The available type of sort orders are.</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>None</term>
            <description>The data source is not sorting.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Ascending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with ascending order.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Descending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with descending order.</description>
            </item>
            </list>

            </value>

            </value>

            </summary>
            <summary>
            The MultiSelect component contains a list of predefined values from which a multiple value can be chosen.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The MultiSelect component contains a list of predefined values from which a multiple value can be chosen.

            </summary>

            </summary>

            </summary>

            <typeparam name="TItem">Specifies the type of SfMultiSelect.</typeparam>

BoundAttributes.Name: TValue
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TValue for the Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMultiSelect<TValue, TItem> component.

BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TItem for the Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMultiSelect<TValue, TItem> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the id of the MultiSelect component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the component allows the user to interact with it.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.</para>
            <para>If enabled,  the `Value` state will be persisted.</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Value</term>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the content that has to be passed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueExpression
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the expression for defining the value of the bound.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowCustomValue
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Allows user to add a
            Custom value the value which is not present in the suggestion list.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableVirtualization
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The Virtual Scrolling feature is used to display a large amount of data that you require without buffering the entire load of a huge database records in the DropDowns, that is, when scrolling, the datamanager request is sent to fetch some amount of data from the server dynamically.
            To achieve this scenario with DropDowns, set the EnableVirtualization to true.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ItemsCount
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The data can be fetched in popup based on ItemsCount, when enabled the EnableVirtualization.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowFiltering
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>To enable the filtering option in this component.</para>
            <para>Filter action performs when type in search box and collect the matched item through `Filtering` event.</para>
            <para>If searching character does not match, `NoRecordsTemplate` property value will be shown.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableChangeOnBlur
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>By default, the MultiSelect component fires the Change event while focus out the component.</para>
            <para>If you want to fires the Change event on every value selection and remove, then disable the EnabledChangeOnBlur property.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableCloseOnSelect
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Based on the property, when item get select popup visibility state will changed.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the MultiSelect. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a MultiSelect.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: DelimiterChar
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the delimiter character for 'default' and 'delimiter' visibility modes.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableGroupCheckBox
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Specifies a boolean value that indicates the whether the grouped list items are
            allowed to check by checking the group header in checkbox mode.</para>
            <para>By default, there is no checkbox provided for group headers.</para>
            <para>This property allows you to render checkbox for group headers and to select
            all the grouped items at once.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableSelectionOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Reorder the selected items in popup visibility state.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterBarPlaceholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Accepts the value to be displayed as a watermark text on the filter bar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the floating label behavior of the MultiSelect that the placeholder text floats above the MultiSelect based on the following values.
            <para>Possible values are: </para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Never</term>
            <description>Never floats the label in the MultiSelect when the placeholder is available.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Always</term>
            <description>The floating label always floats above the MultiSelect.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Auto</term>
            <description>The floating label floats above the MultiSelect after focusing it or when enters the value in it.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: HideSelectedItem
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Hides the selected item from the list item.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
            <para>If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: InputAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
            <para>If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: MaximumSelectionLength
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Sets limitation to the value selection.</para>
            <para>Based on the limitation, list selection will be prevented.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Mode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            configures visibility mode for component interaction.
            </summary>

<summary>
            The MultiSelect component contains a list of predefined values from which a multiple value can be chosen.
            </summary>

            </summary>

            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TValue for the Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMultiSelect<TValue, TItem> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the id of the MultiSelect component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the component allows the user to interact with it.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.</para>
            <para>If enabled,  the `Value` state will be persisted.</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Value</term>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the content that has to be passed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueExpression
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the expression for defining the value of the bound.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowCustomValue
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Allows user to add a
            Custom value the value which is not present in the suggestion list.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableVirtualization
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The Virtual Scrolling feature is used to display a large amount of data that you require without buffering the entire load of a huge database records in the DropDowns, that is, when scrolling, the datamanager request is sent to fetch some amount of data from the server dynamically.
            To achieve this scenario with DropDowns, set the EnableVirtualization to true.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ItemsCount
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The data can be fetched in popup based on ItemsCount, when enabled the EnableVirtualization.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowFiltering
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>To enable the filtering option in this component.</para>
            <para>Filter action performs when type in search box and collect the matched item through `Filtering` event.</para>
            <para>If searching character does not match, `NoRecordsTemplate` property value will be shown.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableChangeOnBlur
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>By default, the MultiSelect component fires the Change event while focus out the component.</para>
            <para>If you want to fires the Change event on every value selection and remove, then disable the EnabledChangeOnBlur property.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableCloseOnSelect
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Based on the property, when item get select popup visibility state will changed.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the MultiSelect. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a MultiSelect.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: DelimiterChar
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the delimiter character for 'default' and 'delimiter' visibility modes.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableGroupCheckBox
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Specifies a boolean value that indicates the whether the grouped list items are
            allowed to check by checking the group header in checkbox mode.</para>
            <para>By default, there is no checkbox provided for group headers.</para>
            <para>This property allows you to render checkbox for group headers and to select
            all the grouped items at once.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableSelectionOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Reorder the selected items in popup visibility state.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterBarPlaceholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Accepts the value to be displayed as a watermark text on the filter bar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the floating label behavior of the MultiSelect that the placeholder text floats above the MultiSelect based on the following values.
            <para>Possible values are: </para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Never</term>
            <description>Never floats the label in the MultiSelect when the placeholder is available.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Always</term>
            <description>The floating label always floats above the MultiSelect.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Auto</term>
            <description>The floating label floats above the MultiSelect after focusing it or when enters the value in it.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: HideSelectedItem
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Hides the selected item from the list item.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
            <para>If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: InputAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
            <para>If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: MaximumSelectionLength
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Sets limitation to the value selection.</para>
            <para>Based on the limitation, list selection will be prevented.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Mode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            configures visibility mode for component interaction.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OpenOnClick
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Whether to automatically open the popup when the control is clicked.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Placeholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder until the user focuses or enter a value in MultiSelect. The property is depending on the FloatLabelType property.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupHeight
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the height of the popup list. By default, it renders based on its list item.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupWidth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the width of the popup list and percentage values has calculated based on input width.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Readonly
BoundAttributes.Documentation:

            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: SortOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Specifies the `SortOrder` to sort the data source.</para>
            <para>The available type of sort orders are.</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>None</term>
            <description>The data source is not sorting.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Ascending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with ascending order.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Descending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with descending order.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The order of sorting the list items. The default value is <c>SortOrder.None</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: DataSource
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Gets or sets the list items either through local or remote service and binds it to the component.</para>
            <para>It can be an array of JSON Objects or an instance of `DataManager`.</para>
            </summary>
            <value> 
            Binding data to the popup element. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Query
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the external `Query` that execute along with data processing.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            Query value to be used for data fetching. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets which filter type, the component needs to be considered on search action.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The filter type specifed for searching the list items. The default value is <c>FilterType.StartsWith</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IgnoreCase
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether case-sensitivity is enabled or disabled when searching for suggestions.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>false</c>, consider the `case-sensitive` on performing the search to find suggestions. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IgnoreAccent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether diacritic characters or accents are ignored.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, ignores the diacritic characters or accents when filtering. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ZIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the z-index value of the component popup element.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The ZIndex value for the popup element.The default value is <c>1000</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Name
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
             Optionally gives a name to the provided value. Descendant components
             will be able to receive the value by specifying this name.
            
             If no name is specified, then descendant components will receive the
             value based the type of value they are requesting.
             </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsFixed
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            If true, indicates that <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.CascadingValue`1.Value" /> will not change. This is a
            performance optimization that allows the framework to skip setting up
            change notifications. Set this flag only if you will not change
            <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.CascadingValue`1.Value" /> during the component's lifetime.
            </summary>
