TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfPager
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            Methods partial class
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the ID of the Pager component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Property which maps the given value to the Pager ID.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Defines the child content which is given inside the pager component.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: CurrentPage
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the current page number of the Pager.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The entered page number is shown when the Pager is rendered, by default the value is 1.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            If the given current page number is greater than the total number of pages present in the pager, then by default the first page will be the current page.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: NumericItemPrefix
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the text to append as a prefix with numeric values in the Pager.
            </summary>
            <value>
            A prefix for numeric item. The default value is <c>string.Empty</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowPagerMessage
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets whether to enable or disable the Pager message, displayed on the right side of the Pager icons. true If `ShowPagerMessage` is set to true, the pager information such as the current page, total pages, and total records count is displayed. By default the ShowPagerMessage is set to true.

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets whether to enable the persistence in the Pager, It will allow access to store the current state of the Pager. true If `EnablePersistence` is set to true, It will store the pager state such as current page, page size, current focus, and pager dropdown in the window.localStorage when the component is disposed. By default the EnablePersistence is set to false.

BoundAttributes.Name: NumericItemsCount
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a value that indicates the number of page numeric buttons shown on the pager user interface. The number of page numeric buttons shown on the pager UI. If NumericItemsCount is 5 and the total number of pages is 20, then the pager will display numeric buttons for pages 1 to 5. Users can navigate beyond this range using the next page and end-page buttons. Also, if the given numeric items count is greater than the total number of pages, then all the pages are shown in the Pager component.

BoundAttributes.Name: PageSize
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the number of items shown on a single page.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The number of items shown on a single page, by default the value is 12. 
            </value>
            <remarks>
            When the given page size is greater than the total items present in the Pager, then all the items are dispalyed in the current page.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: PageSizes
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the list of items in the Pager dropdown. Update what number of items can be rendered on a page by changing the dropdown value. The list of items to be shown in the Pager dropdown, by default the value is set to null. When one of the given page sizes is greater than the total items present in the Pager, when the particular dropdown is chosen all the items are dispalyed in the current page. @code{ public List pagesizes = new List { 5, 10, 12, 20 }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowAllInPageSizes
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets whether to add a All as one of the option in the Pager dropdown list. Total items can be rendered while changing the Pager dropdown value as All. true If `ShowAllInPageSizes` is set to true, then added All value as one of the option in . should be updated with list items for this property, otherwise it's not needed. The default value is false.

BoundAttributes.Name: Template
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the template to customize the pager UI with customized elements instead of the default UI. The template content. Use the templates context parameter to access a and its fields. @code { SfPager Page; private async Task PageValueHandler(ChangeEventArgs args) { await Page.GoToPageAsync(args.Value); } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: TotalItemsCount
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the total number of items, to calculate <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfPager.TotalPages" /> count based on <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfPager.PageSize" />.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The number of total items present in the pager component to calculate <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfPager.TotalPages" />.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the CSS class name, that can be appended with the root element of the Pager. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to the Pager.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Property in which the CSS classes are added. The default value is an empty string.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ItemClick
BoundAttributes.Documentation: An event that is raised when the numeric item is clicked. This event handler receives a object which provides the details of new page navigation. @code{ public void HandletemClick(PagerItemClickEventArgs args) { // Enter the code here } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: PageChanging
BoundAttributes.Documentation: An event that is raised when navigating to a new page. This event handler receives a object which provides the details of new page navigation. @code{ public void HandlePageChanging(PageChangingEventArgs args) { // Enter the code here } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: PageChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation: An event that is raised when navigated to a new page. This event handler receives a object which provides the details of navigated page. @code{ public void HandlePageChanged(PageChangedEventArgs args) { // Enter the code here } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Created
BoundAttributes.Documentation: An event that is raised when Pager component is created. @code{ public void HandlePagerCreated() { // Enter the code here... } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: PageSizeChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation: An event that is raised, While dynamically change the pager size by using pager dropdown. This event handler receives a object which provides the details of updated pagesize. @code{ public List pagesizes = new List { 5, 10, 12, 20 }; public void HandlePageSizeChanged(PageSizeChangedArgs args) { // Enter the code here... } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: PageSizeChanging
BoundAttributes.Documentation: An event that is raised, when dynamically changing the page size using the page sizes dropdown. This event handler receives a object which provides the details of current pagesize. @code{ public List pagesizes = new List { 5, 10, 12, 20 }; public void HandlePageSizeChanging(PageSizeChangingArgs args) { // Enter the code here... } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Context
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the parameter name for all child content expressions.

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfSidebar
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The SfSidebar component is an expandable and collapsible component that typically acts as a side container to place primary or secondary content alongside the main content.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            Partial Class SfSidebar.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            Partial Class SfSidebar.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            Partial Class SfSidebar.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            Partial Class SfSidebar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Changed
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the state(expand/collapse) of the component is changed.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnClose
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the component is ready to close.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Created
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the component is created.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Destroyed
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the component gets destroyed.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnOpen
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the component is ready to open.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets id attribute for the sidebar element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the child content.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Animate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable the animation transitions on expanding or collapsing the Sidebar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CloseOnDocumentClick
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether the Sidebar needs to be closed or not when the document area is clicked.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: DockSize
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the size of the Sidebar in dock state. Dock size can be set in pixel values.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableDock
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the docking state of the component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableGestures
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enables the expand or collapse while swiping in the touch devices.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable the persisting component's state between page reloads. If enabled, isOpen state will be persisted.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable rendering Sidebar in right to left direction.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsOpen
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the Sidebar component is open or close.
            When the Sidebar type is set to `Auto`,
            the component will be expanded in the desktop and collapsed in the mobile mode regardless of the isOpen property.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsOpenChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a callback of the bound value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: MediaQuery
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the media query string for resolution, when opens the Sidebar.
            Example: assigning media query value to '(min-width: 600px)' will open the sidebar component only when the provided resolution is met else the sidebar will be in closed state.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Position
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the position of the Sidebar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowBackdrop
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether to apply overlay options to the main content or not when the Sidebar is in an open state.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Target
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Allows to place the sidebar inside the target element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Type
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the expanding types of the Sidebar.
            `Over` - The sidebar floats over the main content area.
            `Push` - The sidebar pushes the main content area to appear side-by-side and shrinks the main content within the screen width.
            `Slide` - The sidebar translates the x and y positions of the main content area based on the sidebar width.
            The main content area will not be adjusted within the screen width.
             `Auto` - Sidebar with `Over` type in mobile resolution and `Push` type in other higher resolutions.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the width of the Sidebar. By default, the width of the Sidebar sets based on the size of its content.
            Width can also be set in pixel values.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ZIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the z-index of the Sidebar. It is applicable only when sidebar act as the overlay type.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
            </summary>

            Allows to place the sidebar inside the target element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Type
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the expanding types of the Sidebar.
            `Over` - The sidebar floats over the main content area.
            `Push` - The sidebar pushes the main content area to appear side-by-side and shrinks the main content within the screen width.
            `Slide` - The sidebar translates the x and y positions of the main content area based on the sidebar width.
            The main content area will not be adjusted within the screen width.
             `Auto` - Sidebar with `Over` type in mobile resolution and `Push` type in other higher resolutions.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the width of the Sidebar. By default, the width of the Sidebar sets based on the size of its content.
            Width can also be set in pixel values.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ZIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the z-index of the Sidebar. It is applicable only when sidebar act as the overlay type.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfSidebar.ChildContent
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the child content.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            Tab is a content panel to show multiple contents in a compact space. Also, only one tab is active at a time. Each Tab item has an associated content, that will be displayed based on the active Tab.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            Tab is a content panel to show multiple contents in a compact space. Also, only one tab is active at a time. Each Tab item has an associated content, that will be displayed based on the active Tab.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            Tab is a content panel to show multiple contents in a compact space. Also, only one tab is active at a time. Each Tab item has an associated content, that will be displayed based on the active Tab.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            Tab is a content panel to show multiple contents in a compact space. Also, only one tab is active at a time. Each Tab item has an associated content, that will be displayed based on the active Tab.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets ID attribute for the tab element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Child Content for Tab.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Animation
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the animation settings of the Tabs component. The animation effect can be applied to activate the tab with duration and delay.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the CSS classes to the root element of the Tabs that helps to customize the component styles.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.
            If enabled, the tabs selected item will be persisted.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowDragAndDrop
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Indicates whether the Tab allows drag and drop over tab items. Tab item has been reordered based on the dropped item.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: DragArea
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Defines the area in which the draggable element movement will be occurring. Outside that area will be restricted
            for the draggable element movement. By default, the draggable element movement occurs with Tabitems.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable rendering component in the right to left (RTL) direction.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: HeaderPlacement
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the orientation of the Tab header.
            The possible values are:
            - Top: Places the Tab header on the top.
            - Bottom: Places the Tab header at the bottom.
            - Left: Places the Tab header at the left.
            - Right: Places the Tab header at the right.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Height
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the height of the Tabs component. By default, Tab height is set based on the height of its parent.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Items
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A list of items that are used to configure the Tabs component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: LoadOn
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the modes for the Tab content.
            The possible modes are:
            `Dynamic` Load the Tab content dynamically, which is rendering its content when switching its header.
            `Init` Loads all the tab contents on initial loading.
            `Demand` Loads the Tab content when required but keeps the content once it is rendered.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Locale
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OverflowMode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the display mode which will be applied when the Tabs exceeds the viewing area.
            The possible modes are:
            - Scrollable: All the elements will be displayed in a single line with horizontal scrolling enabled.
            - Popup: Tab container will hold the items that can be placed within the available space and the rest of the items will be moved to the popup.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ScrollStep
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the scrolling distance that applies when scrolling in Tab and enabled Scrollable mode.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: SelectedItem
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the index for activating the Tab item.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: SelectedItemChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a callback of the bound value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowCloseButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a value that indicates whether to show the close button in the Tab header or not.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ReorderActiveTab
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to re-order tab items to show active tab item in the header area or popup when OverflowMode is Popup.
            </summary>
            <value>
            true, if active tab item should be visible in header area instead of pop-up; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.ReorderActiveTab" /> Property is only applicable when OverflowMode is popup.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the width of the Tabs component. By default, Tab width sets based on the width of its parent.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional html attributes such as id, title etc., to the tab element.
            </summary>

            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconCss
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the icon class that is used to render an icon in the Tab header.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Options for positioning the icon in the Tab item header. This property depends on the `IconCss` property.
            The possible values are:
            - left: Places the icon to the `left` of the item.
            - top: Places the icon on the `top` of the item.
            - right: Places the icon to the `right` end of the item.
            - bottom: Places the icon at the `bottom` of the item.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Text
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the display text of the Tab header.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OverflowMode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that indicates how to display toolbar items when the toolbar content exceeds the viewing area.
            </summary>
            <value>
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowMode" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowMode.Scrollable" />
            </value>
            <remarks>
            If the <c>OverflowMode</c> is <c>Scrollable</c>, all the elements are displayed in a single line with enabled horizontal scrolling.
            If the <c>OverflowMode</c> is <c>Popup</c>, prioritized elements are displayed on the toolbar and the rest of elements are moved to the popup.
            If the popup content overflows the height of the page, the rest of the elements will be hidden.
            If the <c>OverflowMode</c> is <c>MultiRow</c>, overflow toolbar items are displayed as in-line of toolbar.
            If the <c>OverflowMode</c> is <c>Extended</c>, hides the overflow items in next row. The extended content were shown when click on the expand icon.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Align
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the location for aligning toolbar items on the toolbar.
            </summary>
            <value>
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemAlign" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemAlign.Left" />
            </value>
            <remarks>
            If the <c>ItemAlign</c> is <c>Left</c>, the toolbar item aligned from left side of toolbar.
            If the <c>ItemAlign</c> is <c>Center</c>, the toolbar item aligned from center of toolbar.
            If the <c>ItemAlign</c> is <c>Right</c>, the toolbar item aligned from right side of toolbar.
            Each item will be aligned according to the <c>Align</c> property.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Id
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the unique ID for toolbar button or input element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Overflow
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to display the toolbar item on toolbar or not, when the content is too large to fit available space.
            </summary>
            <value>
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowOption" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowOption.None" />
            </value>
            <remarks>
            If the <c>OverflowOption</c> is <c>Show</c>, always shows the toolbar item as the primary priority on the Toolbar.
            If the <c>OverflowOption</c> is <c>Hide</c>, always shows the toolbar item as the secondary priority on the popup.
            If the <c>OverflowOption</c> is <c>None</c>, no priority were set for toolbar item, as per normal order moves to popup when content exceeds.
            This property is applicable only when <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowMode" /> is <c>Popup</c> of <c>Extended</c>.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: PrefixIcon
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the classes to display an icon for toolbar button item. Accepts a string value. The default value is String.Empty. The icon will be positioned before the text content if is available, otherwise the icon alone will be rendered. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowAlwaysInPopup
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the toolbar items whether to display always in popup or not.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, to render the toolbar item in popup. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            It allows to maintain toolbar item on popup always but it does not work for toolbar priority items.
            This property is applicable only when <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowMode" /> is <c>Popup</c> of <c>Extended</c>.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: TabIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets the tab order of the Toolbar items. When positive values assigned, it allows to switch focus to the next/previous toolbar items with Tab/ShiftTab keys.
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Tab index of toolbar item. The default value is `-1`. 
            </value> 
            <remarks>
            By default, user can able to switch between items only via arrow keys.
            If the value is set to 0 for all tool bar items, then tab switches based on element order.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowTextOn
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to display the button text on toolbar or popup.
            </summary>
            <value>
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.DisplayMode" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.DisplayMode.Both" />
            </value>
            <remarks>
            If the <c>DisplayMode</c> is <c>Toolbar</c>, text will be displayed on Toolbar only.
            If the <c>DisplayMode</c> is <c>Overflow</c>, text will be displayed only when content overflows to popup.
            If the <c>DisplayMode</c> is <c>Both</c>, text will be displayed on both popup and Toolbar.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: SuffixIcon
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the classes to display an icon for toolbar button item. Accepts a string value. The default value is String.Empty. The icon will be positioned after the text content if is available, otherwise the icon alone will be rendered. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Template
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the HTML element content for the toolbar item. The value used to build the content. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Text
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the text content for toolbar button item. Accepts a string value. The default value is String.Empty. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: TooltipText
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the tooltip text content to be displayed on hovering the toolbar button item. Accepts a string value. The default value is String.Empty. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Type
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the type of toolbar item to be rendered in toolbar.
            </summary>
            <value>
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemType" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemType.Button" />
            </value>
            <remarks>
            If the <c>ItemType</c> is <c>Button</c>, creates the Button control with its given properties like text, prefixIcon, etc.
            If the <c>ItemType</c> is <c>Separator</c>, adds a horizontal line that separates the toolbar item.
            If the <c>ItemType</c> is <c>Input</c>, creates an input element that is applicable to template rendering with Syncfusion controls like DropDownList, AutoComplete, etc.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Visible
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether the toolbar item is hidden or not.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>false</c>, to hide the toolbar item. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets the width of the toolbar button item in pixels/number/percentage. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            If we set the width value, then the toolbar button item will render based on specified width otherwise the default width value <c>auto</c> is set.  
            </value>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView<TValue>
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The TreeView component is used to represent hierarchical data in a tree like structure with editing, drag and drop, checkboxes, expand and collapse, and more.
            </summary>
            <typeparam name="TValue">"TValue parameter".</typeparam>
            <summary>
            Specifies the TreeView component.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The TreeView component is used to represent hierarchical data in a tree like structure with editing, drag and drop, checkboxes, expand and collapse, and more.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The TreeView component is used to represent hierarchical data in a tree like structure with editing, drag and drop, checkboxes, expand and collapse, and more.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: TValue
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TValue for the Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView<TValue> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<exclude />
            <summary>
            Gets or sets the content to display within a TreeView component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowDragAndDrop
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether the TreeView allows drag and drop of nodes to reordering the nodes. 
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if drag and drop operation is allowed; otherwise 'false'. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks>
            In desktop device, drag and drop a node using mouse down on the node and drag it to the target node
            and drop the node by releasing the mouse.
            In touch device, drag and drop nodes using touch start, touch move and and touch end events.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowEditing
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether allow to edit a node's text by pressing F2 key or double-click on a TreeView node. 
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if editing is allowed; otherwise 'false'. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks>
            When `AllowEditing` property is set to true, the TreeView allows to edit a node
            by double clicking on the node or by navigating to the node and pressing F2 key. 
            When the property is set to false, the TreeView allows to read the node'text only. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowMultiSelection
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable multi-selection of nodes. 
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if multiple nodes can be selected. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks>
            To select multiple nodes, select the nodes by holding down the CTRL key and clicking on the nodes.
            To select consecutive nodes, select initial node and hold down the SHIFT key and click on the final node .
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowTextWrap
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to wrap the node's text in the TreeView. 
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if node's text can be wrapped around a node. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks>
            When the `AllowTextWrap` property is set to true, the TreeView node's text wrap to the next line
            when its text content exceeds the width of the TreeView node.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Animation
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the type of animation applied on expanding and collapsing the nodes along with duration.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AutoCheck
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether allow to update a parent checkbox state based on child's checked state.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            'false' if the parent and child node relation is not required. The default value is <c>true</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks>
            This property works when <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.ShowCheckBox" /> is set to true.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: CheckedNodes
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the ID of checked nodes in the TreeView component. Pass the node's ID as string array collection. Supports two-way binding. This property returns the checked nodes ID in the TreeView component. A TreeView with checked nodes. @code{ public class MusicAlbum { public int Id { get; set; } public int? ParentId { get; set; } public string Name { get; set; } public bool Expanded { get; set; } public bool? IsChecked { get; set; } public bool HasChild { get; set; } } SfTreeView tree; string[] CheckedNodes = new string[] { "16","18" }; List Albums = new List(); protected override void OnInitialized() { base.OnInitialized(); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 14, HasChild = true, Name = "MP3 Albums", Expanded = true }); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 15, ParentId = 14, Name = "Rock" }); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 16, Name = "Gospel", ParentId = 14, }); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 17, ParentId = 14, Name = "Latin Music" }); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 18, ParentId = 14, Name = "Jazz" }); } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: CheckedNodesChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the checked nodes changes.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets one or more CSS classes to customize the appearance of TreeView. Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance of TreeView. The default value is String.Empty. Setting styles through CssClass will be reflected in the corresponding TreeView. A TreeView with custom class attribute. @code{ public class MusicAlbum { public int Id { get; set; } public int? ParentId { get; set; } public string Name { get; set; } public bool Expanded { get; set; } public bool? IsChecked { get; set; } public bool HasChild { get; set; } } SfTreeView tree; List Albums = new List(); protected override void OnInitialized() { base.OnInitialized(); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 14, HasChild = true, Name = "MP3 Albums", Expanded = true }); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 15, ParentId = 14, Name = "Rock" }); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 16, Name = "Gospel", ParentId = 14, }); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 17, ParentId = 14, Name = "Latin Music" }); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 18, ParentId = 14, Name = "Jazz" }); } }

BoundAttributes.Name: Disabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the TreeView component.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the TreeView component is disabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            When set to true, the user interaction with the TreeView will be prevented. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: DropArea
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the target in which the draggable element can be moved and dropped. By default, the draggable element movement occurs in the page. A TreeView with drop area target attribute.
@code{ public class MusicAlbum { public int Id { get; set; } public int? ParentId { get; set; } public string Name { get; set; } public bool Expanded { get; set; } public bool? IsChecked { get; set; } public bool HasChild { get; set; } } SfTreeView tree; List Albums = new List(); protected override void OnInitialized() { base.OnInitialized(); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 14, HasChild = true, Name = "MP3 Albums", Expanded = true }); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 15, ParentId = 14, Name = "Rock" }); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 16, Name = "Gospel", ParentId = 14, }); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 17, ParentId = 14, Name = "Latin Music" }); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 18, ParentId = 14, Name = "Jazz" }); } }

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableHtmlSanitizer
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to allow the cross-scripting site or not.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to persist component's state between page reloads.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the component's state persistence is enabled. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            The following component's property will be stored in browser local storage to persist component's state when page reloads.
            1. `SelectedNodes` - Represents the nodes that are selected in the TreeView component.
            2. `checkedNodes`  - Represents the nodes that are checked in the TreeView component.
            3. `expandedNodes` - Represents the nodes that are expanded in the TreeView component.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether the right to left direction is enabled for TreeView component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction is enabled for TreeView component. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ExpandOn
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the value that indicates the action on which the node expands or collapses. The default value is DblClick. The available actions: `Click` - The expand/collapse operation happens when you single-click on the node in desktop. `DblClick` - The expand/collapse operation happens when you double-click on the node in desktop. `None` - The expand/collapse operation will not happen. In mobile devices, the node expand/collapse action happens on single tap. A TreeView with ExpandOn attribute. Here ExpandOn attribute is set to single click. @code{ public class MusicAlbum { public int Id { get; set; } public int? ParentId { get; set; } public string Name { get; set; } public bool Expanded { get; set; } public bool? IsChecked { get; set; } public bool HasChild { get; set; } } SfTreeView tree; List Albums = new List(); protected override void OnInitialized() { base.OnInitialized(); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 14, HasChild = true, Name = "MP3 Albums", Expanded = true }); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 15, ParentId = 14, Name = "Rock" }); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 16, Name = "Gospel", ParentId = 14, }); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 17, ParentId = 14, Name = "Latin Music" }); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 18, ParentId = 14, Name = "Jazz" }); } } ]]>

IsChecked { get; set; } public bool HasChild { get; set; } } SfTreeView tree; string[] ExpandedNodes = new string[] { "16","18" }; List Albums = new List(); protected override void OnInitialized() { base.OnInitialized(); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 14, HasChild = true, Name = "MP3 Albums" }); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 15, ParentId = 14, Name = "Rock" }); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 16, Name = "Gospel", ParentId = 14, }); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 17, ParentId = 14, Name = "Latin Music" }); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 18, ParentId = 14, Name = "Jazz" }); } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ExpandedNodesChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the expanded nodes changes.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Fields
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the data source and mapping fields to render TreeView nodes.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FullRowNavigable
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the value that indicates whether the entire TreeView node will be navigate-able instead of text element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            'true' to make the entire TreeView node navigate-able; Otherwise 'false'. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            When this property is set to true, the navigation occurs when clicked on any part of the TreeView node. 
            Otherwise the navigation occurs while clicking on the TreeView node's text only.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: FullRowSelect
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the value that indicates whether the entire row of the TreeView node gets selected by clicking a node.
            </summary>
            <value>
            'true' to select the entire node; otherwise,node's text section only selected. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            The entire tree node can be selectable if the property is set to true. Otherwise, the node's text section can be selected while select a node.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: LoadOnDemand
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether child nodes will be rendered while expand and collapse of parent node instead of loading all the tree nodes initially.
            </summary>
            <value>
            'true' to load the child nodes dynamically on expand a parent node; Otherwise,'false'. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            By default, the load on demand (Lazy load) is set to true. So, all the child nodes are rendered dynamically while expanding a parent node. By disabling this property, all the child nodes are rendered on initial loading itself.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: SelectedNodes
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the ID of selected nodes in the TreeView component. Pass the node's ID as string array collection. Supports two-way binding. This property returns the selected nodes ID in the TreeView component. A TreeView with expanded nodes. @code{ public class MusicAlbum { public int Id { get; set; } public int? ParentId { get; set; } public string Name { get; set; } public bool Expanded { get; set; } public bool? IsChecked { get; set; } public bool HasChild { get; set; } } SfTreeView tree; string[] SelectedNodes = new string[] { "16","18" }; List Albums = new List(); protected override void OnInitialized() { base.OnInitialized(); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 14, HasChild = true, Name = "MP3 Albums" }); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 15, ParentId = 14, Name = "Rock" }); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 16, Name = "Gospel", ParentId = 14, }); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 17, ParentId = 14, Name = "Latin Music" }); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 18, ParentId = 14, Name = "Jazz" }); } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: SelectedNodesChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the selected nodes changes.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowCheckBox
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether show checkboxes in each node of the TreeView.
            The checkbox displays next to the expand/collapse icon of the node.
            </summary>
            <value>
            'true' to show checkboxes on each tree view nodes; otherwise, 'false'. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            The property used to show or hide the checkboxes in tree node. The checkbox has tri-state behavior such as checked, unchecked, and indeterminate.
            The check/uncheck action can be performed either through checkbox click or pressing space key.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: SortOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the nodes are sorted in the ascending or descending order.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            The available types of sort order are,
             `None` - The nodes are not sorted.
             `Ascending` - The nodes are sorted in the ascending order.
             `Descending` - The nodes are sorted in the descending order.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the HtmlAttributes for TreeView.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets id attribute for the TreeView element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the value that indicates whether the entire TreeView node will be navigate-able instead of text element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            'true' to make the entire TreeView node navigate-able; Otherwise 'false'. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            When this property is set to true, the navigation occurs when clicked on any part of the TreeView node. 
            Otherwise the navigation occurs while clicking on the TreeView node's text only.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: FullRowSelect
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the value that indicates whether the entire row of the TreeView node gets selected by clicking a node.
            </summary>
            <value>
            'true' to select the entire node; otherwise,node's text section only selected. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            The entire tree node can be selectable if the property is set to true. Otherwise, the node's text section can be selected while select a node.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: LoadOnDemand
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether child nodes will be rendered while expand and collapse of parent node instead of loading all the tree nodes initially.
            </summary>
            <value>
            'true' to load the child nodes dynamically on expand a parent node; Otherwise,'false'. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            By default, the load on demand (Lazy load) is set to true. So, all the child nodes are rendered dynamically while expanding a parent node. By disabling this property, all the child nodes are rendered on initial loading itself.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: SelectedNodes
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the ID of selected nodes in the TreeView component. Pass the node's ID as string array collection. Supports two-way binding. This property returns the selected nodes ID in the TreeView component. A TreeView with expanded nodes. @code{ public class MusicAlbum { public int Id { get; set; } public int? ParentId { get; set; } public string Name { get; set; } public bool Expanded { get; set; } public bool? IsChecked { get; set; } public bool HasChild { get; set; } } SfTreeView tree; string[] SelectedNodes = new string[] { "16","18" }; List Albums = new List(); protected override void OnInitialized() { base.OnInitialized(); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 14, HasChild = true, Name = "MP3 Albums" }); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 15, ParentId = 14, Name = "Rock" }); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 16, Name = "Gospel", ParentId = 14, }); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 17, ParentId = 14, Name = "Latin Music" }); Albums.Add(new MusicAlbum { Id = 18, ParentId = 14, Name = "Jazz" }); } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: SelectedNodesChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the selected nodes changes.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowCheckBox
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether show checkboxes in each node of the TreeView.
            The checkbox displays next to the expand/collapse icon of the node.
            </summary>
            <value>
            'true' to show checkboxes on each tree view nodes; otherwise, 'false'. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            The property used to show or hide the checkboxes in tree node. The checkbox has tri-state behavior such as checked, unchecked, and indeterminate.
            The check/uncheck action can be performed either through checkbox click or pressing space key.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: SortOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the nodes are sorted in the ascending or descending order.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            The available types of sort order are,
             `None` - The nodes are not sorted.
             `Ascending` - The nodes are sorted in the ascending order.
             `Descending` - The nodes are sorted in the descending order.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the HtmlAttributes for TreeView.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets id attribute for the TreeView element.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.TreeViewEvents<TValue>
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The TreeView allows us to control the component by using events.
            </summary>
            <typeparam name="TValue">"Tvalue paramter".</typeparam>

BoundAttributes.Name: TValue
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TValue for the Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.TreeViewEvents<TValue> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: OnActionFailure
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised while any TreeView action failed to fetch the desired results.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            You can capture this failure and throw error message for users in required cases.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Created
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the TreeView component is created successfully.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            You can perform required actions during this component creation.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: DataBound
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when data source is populated in the TreeView.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            The data can be modified or updated at this time when the component is updated with data source.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: DataSourceChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when data source is changed in the TreeView. The data source will be changed after performing some operation like
            drag and drop, node editing, adding and removing node.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            The data source change can be detected and the updated data can be fetched or stored in required cases.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Destroyed
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the TreeView control is destroyed successfully.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
             Required actions can be performed once the component is destroyed.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnNodeRender
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised before the TreeView node is appended to the TreeView element.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
             A specific node can be customized at the time of rendering using this event.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnKeyPress
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when key press is successful. 
            </summary>
            <remarks>
             Helps to customize the operations at key press.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: NodeChecked
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the TreeView node is checked/unchecked successfully.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
             The details of checked/unchecked node can be fetched and required actions can be performed using this event.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: NodeChecking
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised before the TreeView node is to be checked/unchecked.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Check/uncheck action can be prevented for specific nodes in required cases.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: NodeClicked
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the TreeView node is clicked successfully.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Required actions can be performed on node click using this event.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: NodeCollapsed
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the TreeView node collapses successfully.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Helps to identify that a node is collapsed and the collapsed node details can be fetched in this event.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: NodeCollapsing
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised before the TreeView node collapses.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Collapse action can be prevented for specific nodes in required cases.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnNodeDragStart
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the TreeView node drag (move) starts.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Helps to identify the dragged node details.Dragging can be prevented for specific node in required cases.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnNodeDragStop
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the TreeView node dragging (move) stops.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Helps to identify the node drag stop action.Dropped target can be fetched and used to perform required actions.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnNodeDragged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the TreeView node is dragged.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Helps to identify the node drag action.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: NodeDropped
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the TreeView node is dropped on target element successfully.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Helps to identify the node drop action and the dropped index/target can be fetched to perform required actions.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: NodeEdited
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the TreeView node is renamed successfully.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Helps to identify that the node is edited successfully and the new edited text can be obtained here.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: NodeEditing
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised before the TreeView node is renamed.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Node editing can be prevented for specific nodes using this event.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: NodeExpanded
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the TreeView node expands successfully.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Helps to identify that a node is expanded and the expanded node details can be fetched using this event.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: NodeExpanding
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised before the TreeView node is to be expanded.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Expand action can be prevented for specific nodes in required cases using this event.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: NodeSelected
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the TreeView node is selected/unselected successfully.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Selected node details can be obtained here and updated to required places using this event.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: NodeSelecting
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised before the TreeView node is selected/unselected.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            A specific node selection can be prevented using this event.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets the child content for the menu including HTML element. If the child content is not specified, menu is rendered using <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.Internal.SfMenuBase`1.Items" /> property. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            The child content which is specified within <c>SfMenu</c> tag directive is either a string or HTML Element. The menu item is also specified using <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.Internal.SfMenuBase`1.Items" /> property. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets CSS class string to customize the appearance of menu. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance of menu. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the right to left direction in menu bar.
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction is enabled for menu bar. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Items
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the menu items with its properties which will be rendered as ContextMenu.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowItemOnClick
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the mouse click option to show the sub menu. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the sub menu will open only on mouse click. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableScrolling
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the scrollable option in menu bar.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton
TagHelpers.Documentation: Button is a graphical user interface that helps to triggers an event on its click action. It can contain a text, an icon, svg or both. Button content is either by specifying property or by specifying content within tag directive. In the below code example, a basic button is initialized with property. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the child content for the Button including HTML element. If the child content is not specified, button is rendered using <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.Content" /> property. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            The child content which is specified within <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton" /> tag directive is either a string or HTML Element. The string content is also specified using <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.Content" /> property. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Content
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the content of Button component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            Set child content within <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton" /> tag directive, to render as HTML content. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the CSS class string to customize the appearance of button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance of button. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Disabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the button component is disabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the right to left direction for button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction is enabled for button. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconCss
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the CSS class string to include an icon or image for the button.  
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to include an icon or image for the button. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates how to display icons in the button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.IconPosition" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.IconPosition.Left" /> 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Left</c>, the icon will be placed left to the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Right</c>, the icon will be placed right to the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Top</c>, the icon will be placed above the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Bottom</c>, the icon will be placed below the content of the button. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsPrimary
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the primary style for button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the primary style is enabled for button component. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsToggle
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the toggle option for button component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the toggle option is enabled for button component. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a a value that indicates the collection of additional attributes that will applied to the button container element. Additional attributes can be added by specifying as inline attributes or by specifying @attributes directive. In the below code example, button width has been specified as style attribute in tag directive. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnClick
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the is clicked. The event is raised for UI based click only. @code { private void Clicked(MouseEventArgs args) { // Write your code here. } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>

TagHelpers.Documentation: CheckBox is a graphical user interface element that allows you to select one or more options from the choices. It has checked, unchecked, and indeterminate states. In the below code example, a basic checkbox is initialized with Checked property. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: TChecked
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TChecked for the Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfCheckBox<TChecked> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: Label
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the label of checkbox. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: LabelPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates how to display label in the checkbox. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfCheckBox`1.LabelPosition" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.LabelPosition.Before" /> 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>LabelPosition</c> is <c>Before</c>, the label will be placed to the left side of the CheckBox. 
            If the <c>LabelPosition</c> is <c>After</c>, the icon will be placed to the right side of the CheckBox. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Indeterminate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable indeterminate state in the checkbox. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the checkbox is in indeterminate state. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            The <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfCheckBox`1.Indeterminate" /> property overrides this <c>Checked</c> property in initial rendering of Checkbox. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Documentation: <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableTriState

            </summary>

            <c>true</c>, if the checkbox is rendered with tristate. The default value is <c>false</c>.

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfFab
TagHelpers.Documentation: The Blazor FAB Component (Floating Action Button) is an extension of that appears in front of all the contents of the page and performs the primary action. A simple FAB with text content. ]]> FAB with icon. ]]> FAB with icon and text. ]]> FAB with info button style. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsPrimary
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to apply primary style for FAB. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the primary style is applied for FAB component. The default value is <c>true</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Target
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the selector that points to an element in which the FAB will be positioned. The default value is null where FAB is positioned based on viewport of browser. The target element must have relative position, else FAB will get positioned based on the closest element which has relative position. Simple FAB with target. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Visible
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the FAB is visible or hidden. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the FAB is visible. The default value is <c>true</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Position
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets the value that indicates the position of the FAB relative to <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfFab.Target" />. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.FabPosition" /> enumeration that specifies the position of FAB. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.FabPosition.BottomRight" />.
            </value> 
            <remarks>
            To refresh the position of FAB on <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfFab.Target" /> resized, use <see cref="M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfFab.RefreshPositionAsync" /> method. 
            The position will be refreshed automatically when browser resized.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the child content for the Button including HTML element. If the child content is not specified, button is rendered using <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.Content" /> property. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            The child content which is specified within <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton" /> tag directive is either a string or HTML Element. The string content is also specified using <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.Content" /> property. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Content
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the content of Button component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks>

            </remarks>

TagHelpers.Documentation:
The Blazor SpeedDial component that appears in front of all the contents of the page and displays list of action buttons on click which is an extended version of FAB. The button of speed dial is positioned in relative to a view port of browser or . It can display a menu of related actions or a custom content . A simple SpeedDial with action items. ]]> A SpeedDial with popup template.

Feedback Form

Name

Leave Your Comments
]]>

The Blazor SpeedDial component that appears in front of all the contents of the page and displays list of action buttons on click which is an extended version of FAB. The button of speed dial is positioned in relative to a view port of browser or . It can display a menu of related actions or a custom content . A simple SpeedDial with action items. ]]> A SpeedDial with popup template.

            </summary>

            <remarks>

            Also, in `Linear` mode text won't be displayed when <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfSpeedDial.Direction" /> is `Left` or `Right`.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>

            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts the values between 0 and 360. The default value is <c>-1</c>>.

            </remarks>

TagHelpers.Name: Attributes
TagHelpers.Documentation: Merges a collection of attributes into the current element or component.

BoundAttributes.Name: @attributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Merges a collection of attributes into the current element or component.

TagHelpers.Name: Bind
TagHelpers.Documentation: Binds the provided expression to an attribute and a change event, based on the naming of the bind attribute. For example: @bind-value="..." and @bind-value:event="onchange" will assign the current value of the expression to the 'value' attribute, and assign a delegate that attempts to set the value to the 'onchange' attribute.

BoundAttributes.Name: @bind-...
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Binds the provided expression to an attribute and a change event, based on the naming of the bind attribute. For example: @bind-value="..." and @bind-value:event="onchange" will assign the current value of the expression to the 'value' attribute, and assign a delegate that attempts to set the value to the 'onchange' attribute.

BoundAttributeParameters.Name: format
BoundAttributeParameters.Documentation: Specifies a format to convert the value specified by the corresponding bind attribute. For example: @bind-value:format="..." will apply a format string to the value specified in @bind-value="...". The format string can currently only be used with expressions of type DateTime.

BoundAttributeParameters.Name: event
BoundAttributeParameters.Documentation: Specifies the event handler name to attach for change notifications for the value provided by the '@bind-...' attribute.

BoundAttributeParameters.Name: culture
BoundAttributeParameters.Documentation: Specifies the culture to use for conversions.
